Das essen an sich , sehr fein . Und nicht sehr scharf so wie man von indisches essen kennt , ich denke dass die Schärfe ist europäisch angepasst .Service super freundlich , die Location perfekt, vor die tram Haltestelle, oder 10 min zu Fuss von Bahnhof Oerlikon.Der Preis ist Mittelmässig teuer.

Wir haben dieses Restaurant auf TripAdvisor entdeckt, waren spontan dort und waren so angetan, dass wir im Handumdrehen Stammkunden wurden. Einfach alles passt, sehr freundliches Personal & sehr gutes Essen!

Gutes Auswahl indischer und zum Teil anderer Gerichte. Volles Restaurant am Freitagabend. Schön gedämpfte Beleuchtung, es kann aber sehr laut sein um sich zu untethalten. Das Essen war sehr gut jedoch leider in ungewärmten Tellern und nicht in indischen töpfchen.Hinter der Bar arbeitet keiner sodass die Wartezeiten für Getränke sehr lang war.Leider nicht preisgünstig und die Kleider riechen stark nach dem Besuch.
The place looks gorgeous after they renovated the place .the food is gorgeous as all ways and i must say perfect service

Wir hatten 3 Gänge. Es hat gut geschmeckt, es war aber nicht das beste indische Essen das ich in Zürich hatte. Der Service war sehr freundlich, sie wirkten aber sehr unorganisiert. Es wirkte als hätten sie keine Tisch Aufteilung. Eine nach der anderen kam hintereinander mit der Karte oder fragte nach ob wir bestellen wollen obwohl wir dies schon hatten. Hier könnten sie sich noch besser organisieren. Etwas anderes ist der starke Räucherstäbchen (oder etwas anderes?) Geruch im Restaurant. Sehr penetrant. PS: sie reden nur englisch. Nicht geeignet für Personen welche kein englisch sprechen.

I stopped by without knowing the existing reputation, reviews or ratings of this restaurant - I was in the area and wanted to eat.I was pleasantly surprised. The staff explained to me the names and composition of the different dishes since I was particularly interested in a vegan meal. Furthermore, they were very friendly and attentive during the entire time.I enjoyed the meal and the staff and will likely go back when there's an opportunity.

Went there to celebrate my birthday with a group of 10 people . They could have not made it more special for me Amazing food and great service Will be back with my boyfriend for a noce romantic dinner
Ganz ok, ist einen Besuch Wert, aber wie der das platz 1 Zustande kam, bleibt für mich ein Rätsel. Ist halt alles sehr subjektiv ;-)
Super expensive and not really my taste. Very small portions. Atmosphere is ok and staff is profesional
Wir waren mit Freunden dort, die Bedienung war 1 A und das Essen absolut köstlich..... wir kommen bestimmt wieder und können es nur wärmstens weiter empfehlen !
Essen hatte gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis, Bedienung sehr freundlich obwohl es nur Take away war gab es sogar einen Tee für die Wartezeit.

Wir hatten für dieses Jahr unser Geschäftsessen (16 Personen) in diesem Restaurant geplant. Nach telefonischem Kontakt wurde für das Partymenu Buffet (Menu zwei für CHF 45) entschieden um lange Wartezeiten zu vermeiden. Der Starter kam wie abgemacht und war lecker, die Hauptspeise wurde nur Teils serviert (nur ein Chicken Menu, nur ein Vegetable Menu, nur eine Sorte Brot statt ein Assortment of Breads und das Goa Fish Curry Menu wurde kalt serviert. Zum Dessert wurden zwei mini Eiskügelchen aufgetischt, kein Panna Cotta. Am Schluss wurde die Rechnung für 18 statt 16 Personen ausgestellt. Schade, wir hatten eine andere Erwartung und waren einfach enttäuscht. Wir werden so schnell in diesem Restaurant nicht wieder unser Geschäftsessen planen

I had high expectations since the reviews were so amazing. It's a great place but my search for a good indian place in Zurich continues. I did like the service and ambience, it was just that the food was just very good but not amazing.
The best Indian food you can get in Zurich. Awesome Ambience and staff is quite friendly. Service is quite fast.😊
Tried the tawa machi and the lamb seekh kebab for starters and thali for the main course. The food was excellent and the service top class Love the decor of the place !!!!

Nun, wir waren durch die guten Bewertungen neugierig geworden und reservierten an einem Werktag einen Tisch für das Abendessen. Das Lokal war den ganzen Abend über voll und das Personal empfanden wir als freundlich und zuvorkommend. Nun aber als das Essen kam, mussten wir feststellen das dies weder aussergewöhnlich noch geschmacklich ein highlight war. Sehr Europa-angepasst, von wahrer Schärfe keine Spur. Uns fehlten die typischen indischen Gewürze und uns schmeckte es doch irgendwie fade. Sehr schade, denn wir verliessen das Restaurant enttäuscht und nicht mit dem Wunsch wieder zu kommen. Das Preis-/Leisungsverhältnis stimmt leider überhaupt nicht. Super teuer für das was man bekommt.
The best place.excellent services.delicious food .People are warm .Worth spending your time and money.
I loved the food and must say the service is amazing .the host was very warm and welcoming which is very rare to find in zurich . A bit on the expensive side but worth it
Loved the butter chicken , dal makhani, and the palak.beautiful setting and very friendly service.love to back again
Colourful yet smart uniforms, very attentive and friendly service and the best thali i ever had. We will highly recommend
Very popular restaurant so i recommend to reserve before hand Awesome dal makhani and aloo jeera . Great service
This was my 3 visit and as usual the place was booked out but they managed to get me a place at the bar. Service ambience and food all deserve 5 star*****
Was there on New year's Eve and what a fantastic night .we had the 7 course meal and I must say every course was delicious. Will be back soon

Pro+Super lieber Service+schnell+ lecker zb das Butter Chicken!+ Zum Geburtstag gabs eine Überraschung+ drinks wurden in einer Vase serviert - sah spitze aus+ liebevoll aussen dekoriertReservation empfohlen oder sonst zum Mitnehmen.Bitte stellt die Klimaanlage nur etwas runter.Kommen sehr gerne wieder :-)

Took my girlfriend there for her birthday and the guys couldn't do enough for us to make it special. The food is excellent and they make a great Thali for those who can't make their minds up! We will be back for sure!

Was on a 15 day tour and visited more than 12 indian restaurants in different countries but I must say the best came the last .On our last day of the trip we came across tamarind hill,beautifully and elegantly decorated and mouth watering food .Still have the taste of their malai kofta while writing this review

We were a group of 13 rather complicated group but I must say we all were looked after .excellent food and service .I loved the way the restaurant was decorated for Christmas and all the staff in the festive spirit yet professional... Will be back for sure
Hier wird wircklich Indisch gekocht!! Authentische Zutaten richtig zubereitet. Wir kommen wieder. Sehr zuempfehlen ist das Rajasthani Ragda Meat.( Lamm/Poulet) ein Traum.

we had a variety.... all excellent food.Service was good but they were a bit too much selling of wine and extra courses when one didn't really want them. Restaurant was rather comfortable but not as nice as it looked in the pictures.Would definitely go back there again for the food and overall experience.
Kann dieses Restaurant nur wärmstens empfehlen. Das Essen war sehr lecker und die Bedienung sehr herzlich und freundlich. Wir haben den Abend sehr genossen.
Delicious punjabi food and amazing hostess. Their bread(naan & roti) basket is too die for . It’s also centrally located.

Das Essen hier hat super gut geschmeckt. Ganz anderes Niveau im Vergleich mit den anderen indischen Restaurants, wo ich gegessen hab. Ich hab die Teigtaschen mit Hühnchen als Vorspeise gehabt. Das hab ich noch nie bei einem indischen Restaurant gesehen. Es hat natürlich super geschmeckt. Zum Hauptgang hab ich Tandoori butter chicken bestellt. Es hat auch ganz köstlich geschmeckt. Vor allem hat das Restaurant ganz viele gut schmeckende Reissorten und Brotsorten. Allerdings war es ein bisschen teuer. Wahrscheinlich ist es der normale Preis in Zürich. Aber auf jedem Fall ist das Restaurant sehr empfehlenswert!!

We've been there with a pretty large group (10+ people) and we've been welcomed very warmly with a wonderful little apero. The food was delicous through and through! Big big compliment because most of us did choose different dishes but they managed that we could enjoy our dinner as a group together. The service is perfect, very friendly and helpful with all the dishes. We'll come again for sure!

First and foremost from the second you walk in the restaurant you feel better - the staff is very welcoming and polite, the atmosphere is warm and relaxing and the chairs comfortable enough to let go of any worries...In addition, the food is great - as spicy as it should be, though you might want to ask for yogurt, which for me made everything even better! The price is also quite OK, considering of course you are eating in Zurich: for a complete dinner for 2 people, including 2 glasses of wine we paid around 130 Francs.
Лучший индийский ресторан в Цюрихе.Я в восторге . Провела прекрасный вечер со своим мужем. Сервис и еда отличные. Мы точно придем обратно
I want to thank the team to make my anniversary so special Food was excellent and amazing service and I must say the new dessert menu is lovely 😍😍
One of the best restaurants in zurich indeed .... excellent food and beautiful setting .... and i must say very good service ... will definately be back and back again ....
Food is excellent and everything is presented with a distinct touch of creativity. The waiters are really nice and attentive. A must if you like Indian food!!

Precios altos pero merece la pena, deliciosa comida y trato muy amable por parte de los camareros, si ninguna habéis probado la comida hindú este puede ser un buen comienzo, para los ya habituados no os defraudará.

The personnel of the restaurant was very friendly and available.Drinks and starters were served in few minutes and were excellent, rich in flavour and fresh.Main dishes were no disappointment either. I recommend trying wholegrain spicy roti bread. And Masala chai too.Best Indian place I've been to

This restaurant is great, very good service, very good food. It is not very big, so I would suggest to book in advance. The waiters are dressed in typical Indian style, the service very gentle and fast. The food is very good, not so spicy and the waiters can give very good advices, if you do not know what to eat, just ask!

... aber dieser hier gehört wahrhaftig zu den Besten.Die Samosas waren sehr lecker aber absolut traumhaft war das RAJASTHANI RAGDA MEAT. Für meinen Geschmack eine sehr gute (europäische) Schärfe und sehr gut abgestimmte Gewürze.Endlich auch ein asiatisches Restaurant mit drinkbaren Weinen.Die Bedienung sehr freundlich und immer mit einem Lächeln.War heute ganz sicher nicht mein letzter Abend in diesem Restaurant, weiter so!

I just love coming to this place - and I come often. Jimmy is the most passionate, welcoming and hard working host. He is in his restaurant every single day, looks after his staff like they are family and makes his own secret recipe spices once a week! The food is excellent and by far the best you can get in town. They have a slightly different menu depending on the season, and there is live music on every saturday night. Jimmy makes sure every single guest leaves his place with a full stomach and a smile on their face. The best thing is: there will be a second Tamarind Hill opening in Bahnhofstrasse, the center of Zurich, next year!If you are visiting Zurich or haven't stumbled across this jewel of a restaurant... Call them now and book a table. And when you are there, order an Apple Crumble Martini. You are welcome. ;)

Unser fein geschmortes Lamb Roganjosh und das zarte Butter Chicken war geschmacklich hervorragend.Das Lokal ist eher klein und eng, das macht es aber auch stimmungsvoll. Ebenso wie die sehr freundliche Bedienung und der bereits weihnachtlich geschmückte Raum.
Loved the food here. Have variety of dishes to try.service is good , serving quantity is good, however, it is quite expensive for the family.
Une soirée en amoureux, dans un décor de Noël indien, un accueil et un service au top du top... mais surtout une cuisine succulente! À ne pas louper lors de votre passage sur Zurich!
Having tried other Indian restaurants in Zurich it is finally nice to find one that offers a genuine taste of India. Excellent service from efficient, friendly staff.

What a pleasant surprise!!! A taste of authentic India in Zurich. One of the best Indian restaurants I have tried in 10 years. For a young restaurant, it has well experienced service/staff as well as cuisine. Authentic dishes. My favourite the King Prawn Zaffrani followed by the Tamarind Butter Chicken.Attentive staff (special thank you to Sarah). Excellent cocktails with Indian ingredients smartly used. I wld recommend the cocktail Bollywood. Very good wine list -shows good taste and good sense within a range of prices.
Tried their famous Malai kofta and butter chicken ....it was the best I had so far anywhere outside India ....really authentic and warm service
Schönes feierliches Ambiente und festlich gekleidetes Servicepersonal zu Diwali. Sehr guter Drink (Jaipur). Gute Auswahl an Vor- und Hauptspeisen. Sehr gerne wieder !
Waren zum Geburtstag jndisch essen. Ambiete ist super orientalisch. Bedienung zuvorkommend freundlich. Service sehr gut. Das Essen schmeckte ebenfalls ausserordentlich gut. Gerne wieder.
Quel délice que cette cuisine indienne, le lieu est sympathique, l’accueil aimable et courtois, c’était parfait.

Inzwischen war ich zweimal im Tamarind Hill und wurde nicht enttäuscht. An einem Abend war es sehr leer, beim zweiten Mal rammelvoll und Gäste haben bis nach draussen angestanden und gewartet. Ein Reservierung lohnt sich auf jeden Fall. Viele der Gäste waren Inder/Inderinnen, immer ein gutes Zeichen, wenn Gäste aus der Heimat im Restaurant sind. Es hat viel mehr Gerichte als auf dem Online-menu, von mild bis superscharf alles dabei. Die Zubereituns ist sehr schmackhaft, die Portionen sehr gut. Die Bedienung ist sehr freundlich und nimmt Änderungen gerne entgegen. Super, ich komme auf jeden Fall wieder. Danke!

Always amazing in this restaurant. A warm welcome when you enter. Very friendly staff!!! Great decoration!!! The Food is just top!!! Really great!!! It's a place where you feel home!!! Thank you for your hospitality
Gut besucht, umfangreiche Karte, leckeres Essen, nette Bedienung allerdings nicht immer deutschsprachige. Zahlreiche indische Gäste deuten an, dass die Küche wohl recht authentisch ist.

Ausgezeichnetes Essen mit freundlicher und aufmerksamer Bedienung. Das Restaurant bietet Speisen an, die man in der Schweiz eher selten findet. Die Einrichtung ist liebevoll und romatisch, schon fast typisch asiatisch übertrieben. Auch die Darbietung der Speisen ging nicht vergessen, so dass auch das Auge mitisst. Das Preisleistungsverhältnis ist OK. Es ist auf der teueren Seite, aber gerechtfertigt. Das Einzige, was man bemängeln könnte, ist die Akustik - die könnte man verbessern, aber in den meisten Restaurants wird das nicht gemacht, vor allem, wenn alles Andere stimmt. Wenn ich könnte, würde ich dafür einen halben Punkt abziehen, aber der sympathischen Bedienung wegen drücke ich hier ein Auge zu und gebe die volle Punktzahl! Ein Restaurant, wie man sie in Zürich selten findet.

Stets angenehm freundlich/sehr zuvorkommend - der Service stimmt. Das Essen ist extrem lecker, heiss, frisch zubereitet und kommt rasch. Die Gerichte - indische Küche vom feinsten! Das Ambiente ist sehr ansprechend, mit einem Touch zum ungewöhnlichen. Man fühlt sich gleich wohl. Es gibt Abende mit Live-Musik (diverse Stilrichtungen) und tolle Saris geben das Gefühl in Indien zu sein. Preis / Leistung sind super. Immer wieder gern.
Wenn with Friends für a Sunday evening dinner. Amazing Food and Great Ambience .must compiment On The super friendly service . We Finally have a Great Indian Restaurant in zürich. Highly recommended.

We visited for a casual Saturday night dinner after watching a movie.Our order was1. Chettinad chicken2. Malai Kofta3. Tandoori rotiWhere kofta and bread was good, chettinad chicken was terrible,purely because of quality of chicken,it was stinking and tasted really old.Upon complaining about it, the waitress took it back to the kitchen and brought back the same plate.They said we are serving the same chicken since 5.30 and no one else has complained. This was a really bad way of handling a customer complain especially when you are in restaurant industry.In the end , it kept lying on the table and we paid for it.So overall bad dish, and bad customer service.They should really know how to handle if customer complains about the quality.

Good Indian Restaurant if you are in Oerlikon or around it in Zurich.We had dinner twice during our stay in Zurich, it is 5-minute walk away from Swissotel Zurich.The restaurant has a good ambience, good taste as far North Indian cuisines are concerned. The service is prompt, one thing which was different here as compared to other Indian Restaurants in Switzerland - Quantity of Curry. The quantity served here is better than other restaurant in Switzerland.Recommended if you are in Zurich, must try atleast once..!

Bedienung top, Ambiente top, Essen topnur der Preis ist knackig aber im Anbetracht der Leistung gerechtfertigt.Ich fühlte mich nicht in Zürich sondern wie in Indienkann das Restaurant jedem empfehlen :)

I visited this restaurant with my family and I felt I was taken to IndiaThe waiting staff were traditionally dressed and yet modernThe food was very authentic and tasted just like it would back in IndiaI loved the Decor and service and would be back soon for another amazing experience

Very clean, very nice, very friendly, the food was rich and tasty, but because of a few little things, my visit left me a feeling of disappointment for what is/was a top 5 restaurant in Zürich :- the fact that the personal was barely speaking German (English instead) which I found this quite strange for Zürich Oerlikon.- the outfits of the waitress. They are really beautiful, made of colourful quality fabrics, unfortunately a bit cheeky: the depth of their décolleté seems to me inappropriate for a restaurant.- the lack of knowledge about the food served : as we got our orders (a variation of 5 dishes) none of the waitress could explain us (whether in German nor in English) what were exactly the 5 dishes, so I asked but they had to call someone in the back to give us explanation.- after dinner they brought a "kidush fountain" (!!!) to the table and used it to pour us some sweet liquor that none of us really enjoyed. Their intention was certainly good, but I found it totally inappropriate for that kind of location.- price-wise : no meal under 30 CHF (if you add rice or naan)Eventually the whole dining-concept is a fail, and even if the food was good, the satisfaction index is mixed

The staff are all incredibly welcoming. You can see they’re a team that really enjoys working together. Service in Zurich can be sketchy at the best of times but these guys really know how to make you feel comfortable.The lamb shoulder was something very special. - can’t recommend it highly enough. The attention to detail in every aspect of the restaurant is nothing short of art. We had a group of six so we got to sample a lot from the menu. The variety and quality of authentic Indian tastes and spices made dining an interesting, exciting and central part of the experience - as it should be in a great restaurant!We got to chat with the owner, Jimmy, for a while at the end of our night and got to hear all about the inspirations for the menu and the decor. When you have a guy who’s this passionate about what he does, you know you’re in for a special experience.

The staff and the owner were very warm, welcoming and passionate. The food was delicious, authentic and well-priced. The ambience was lovely and so was the interior. There was great live music playing at a volume where you could hold a conversation with your company over drinks and food! I would definitely visit this restaurant again and recommend their meat and vegetarian dishes, especially the Okra and the Chicken Tikka Masala. I absolutely loved the dining experience at this restaurant.

Ich mag dieses Lokal und die vegetarische Malai-Kofta war wirklich sehr lecker und kann für jeden Nichtnuss-Allergiker empfohlen werden. Meiner Begleitung hat das Hähnchen Tikka Masala auch sehr geschmeckt. Somit kann man dem Küchenchef nur gute Noten. Die Einrichtung ist etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig und die Sitzordnung für die zweier Tische in der Mitte bei welchem das Personal fortlaufend vorbeirauscht ist eher unangenehm. Wie andere auch schon vermerkt haben, finde ich es eher stossend, wenn für weisser Reis zum Menü noch CHF 4.50 draufgeschlagen werden.

Wir haben das Tamarinde Hill zufällig entdeckt und waren begeistert vom Essen und dem freundlichen Service. Man fühlt sich tatsächlich nach Indien versetzt, die Atmosphäre und das Essen stimmen einfach perfekt.

Have been in Switzerland for just under a year and have not found a good Indian restaurant. This was a trip advisor recommendation. Turned up on a Sunday without a booking but early. The staff accommodated us nicely. The service was prompt and courteous. Food was good, but not great. Not sure what I was expecting or what to compare to. Trouble is that with Swiss prices, our reference was something with a Michelin back in the uk like Tamarind in London(given the name). So don't get me wrong , food was good authentic but could be better e.g the tandoori did taste a bit stale and the vegetarian thali was a bit basic. I would go again as I have yet to find another decent Indian restaurant.
Tamarind hill indian resturantet es muy acojedor es muy buen restauran pa ra comer pescados y ensaladas todo muy bien

We had 4 different dishes and all of them (except the vegetarian dish - it was good in taste but could've had more spice!) were very delicious! The service is friendly, attentive and nice. Will definitely come back!!

Ich habe heute und vor einer Woche im Tamarind Hill gegessen (Lunch Menu, vegetarisch für CHF 18.95).Beide Male sehr fein, grosse Portion, freundliche Bedienung.Dass Essen kam nach 10 resp. 8 Minuten - was will man mehr?Das Damen-WC ist sauber, originell eingerichtet. Leider ist von den beiden WCs eins unbrauchbar, da sich die Türe verzogen hat und sich nicht mehr zuziehen lässt. Schade, das wäre eigentlich schnell zu beheben.....

I went with a regular habitue of restaurants and resident of Oerlikon. As soon as we walked in, he remarked ion the atmosphere ("most restaurants don't bother") and as we sat at the table, the service (though it would have been nice if the waitress, dressed in a sari, had replaced the paper napkin, as promised!) The food was dear (as it always is in Switzerland). The starters seemed rather strange (lambs pieces, pressed together) and the main course chicken was real lumps, which included leg meat. The bill for two starters, two main courses (with one rice and one naan) and two beers was 115CHF.

This place is located 10 minutes walk straight from Zurich Oerlikon railway station or by tram there is a stop just infront of it. They have parking space infront as well.The ambience is good, the chair arrangement where we sat (infront the bar) was bit congested though. Service was excellent and they were attentive all the time.Drinks first, my wife loved the Lemon Soda and still craving for it. And for the Ginger lemongrass tea, it was okay for me, the taste of ginger was infront, didn't taste lemongrass and could have been a little sweeter. I would try a different drink next time. And for the food, best Indian food we had in Zurich yet! The spice though was adapted for european taste buds. The starter mix platter was excellent and price worthy and a good portion for a starter. The main food, my wife took lamb thali, all the curries tasted good except the one with black beans. Butter chicken which I had was excellent, I still could taste it! But for the price of 32CHF i would say the amount was less or in other words it was less value for money.For the cost of 115 CHF for 2, this was our most expensive Indian food we ever had. If you ask me if I would go again, its definitely an yes for a Fine Dining once in a while!

One of the best Indian places in Switzerland. My husband and I really enjoyed our dinner there this weekend. We arrived 5 minutes early from our reservation time and were asked to wait at the bad while they got our table ready. Decent cocktails, wine and beer selection. We had the onion and sweet potato fritters with tamarind sauce and it was lovely. I had vegetables vindaloo and my husband had the chicken tikka. Both portions were very generous. They warned me that the vindaloo was spicy, but given my Asian tolerance for spiciness, it was just medium spicy for me. We ordered rice and naan as well, so we ended up taking some food home. We live in the Geneva area but wished that this place is closer. We could definitely see ourselves coming here again. Highly recommended.

Sicher unter den allerbesten indischen Restaurants in der Schweiz...Es ist nicht ganz günstig, aber seinen Preis wert.Wir hatten das vegetarische Thali. Da gibt's eine empfehlenswerte Auswahl an Gemüse und Linsengerichten.Ausgezeichneter Service
Tolles Essen, TOP! Auch für Vegetarier!Sehr aufmerksame und freundliche Bedienung. Preise etwas hoch (für ZH jedoch normal), aber es ist das absolut wert!

Cenamos mi esposa y yo en el Tamarind Hill. Dejamos que el mesero escogiera nuestra cena. Mi esposa y yo compartimos una entrada (Somosa). De platillo principal pedido un Tandoori Chicken y un Lamb Roganjosh con un arroz al vapor y nan.La cena estuvo deliciosa. Disfrutamos los platillos. Junto de nosotros se encontraban un indulto y un suizo. Después de cenar nos pusimos a platicar con ellos sobre la comida de la India. Los cuatro disfrutamos los alimentos de Tamarind Hill.
Very deserving of the great reviews. An overall fantastic experience. They were also very kind and helpful with the children. Thanks so much!

Siamo andati a cena in questo ristorante segnalato da un conoscente indiano che ce lo ha caldamente raccomandato. Il locale è ben curato con un arredamento caratteristico per questo tipo di locali e con un servizio premuroso. Abbiamo ordinato, per iniziare, il piatto misto della casa che è risultato molto buono e abbondante, infatti due porzioni sono risultate sufficienti per tre commensali, poi tre diverse pietanze con dell’anatra, del pollo e dell’agnello, il tutto accompagnato da una sorta di focaccia aromatizzata e del riso. Poiché le porzioni erano molto abbondanti e ci dispiaceva sprecare del buon cibo, abbiamo chiesto ed ottenuto di portar via quanto restava ottenendo un perfetto impacchettamento, così abbiamo anche scoperto che è possibile farsi recapitare le pietanze a casa, cosa sicuramente molto utile d’inverno. Il costo finale, compreso il caffè e un liquore offerto, è stato circa 60 franchi a testa, direi decisamente conveniente tenuto conto dei costi di Zurigo. Infine, se uno non ha la macchina e vuole evitare i tassì di Zurigo, può arrivare dal centro, in poco più di un quarto d’ora facilmente, con il tram, mi sembra il 10 e il 14 e anche altri.

The place looks amazing, well-styled and authentic. The staff were nice and very helpful when I had questions about my order.I went there for a dinner and ordered Thali and Naan. One of the best Thalis I ever had! Even the plate itself was interesting, it was styled in a unique crescent shape.I absolutely recommend it, and I'll definitely go there again!(also, the Lassi is awesome)

We visited for a family lunch. The prices were reasonable, but the decoration and the food were very average. Food tasted authentic, but felt like it was toned down for European taste buds. Missing original flavour and spice.Chai masala was lovely, served in original clay pots.
Chicken Tikka Masala, Naan, rice, starter with mint dip all for 22 CHF for a lunch. I found this place perfect if you want to have some 🌶 spicy taste buds.
The best Indian food in Swiss ever. Delicious and taste wow and spices are amazing I ordered plenty of dishes and all were perfect taste I see the prices to be quite high
Nonostante l'apparenza non troppo invitante, abbiamo mangiato molto bene ed ad un prezzo super abbordabile (sopratutto per zurigo). Consigliato :)

This is a short walk from the centre of Oerlikon and they have parking in front of the restaurant.Great service, greta food and greta value for money. some CHF 32 including tip for the lunchtime menu with a soda and a coffee.Some 8 or so choices of curry style: Korma, Tikka Madras etc. Then you pick whether you want chicken, meat or fish.
This Indian restaurant serves a variety of tasty Indian food. The employees are so welcoming and the service is great. Definately worth a try.

Nachdem ich nun 3 mal mit Kunden zum Mittagessen war im Tamarind Hill und alle begeistert waren, war ich heute mit der Familie zum Abendessen.Das Lokal war gut gefüllt, eine sehr internationale Kundschaft, genauso eine buntgemischte Belegschaft - zusammen mit der Einrichtung ergibt sich das Gefühl, nicht mehr in der Schweiz zu sein. Das setzt sich beim Essen fort, das auf hohem Niveau sehr differenziert gekocht ist. Ich hatte wohl noch nie ein Thali in der Schweiz, bei dem die einzelnen Gerichte so unterschiedlich abgeschmeckt waren - da weiss jemand sehr genau mit Gewürzen umzugehen.Auch meine Tochter und meine Frau, die eher "schwierige Esser" sind, waren rundum glücklich.Nicht vergessen sollte man zudem die alkoholischen und nicht-alkoholischen Cocktails, da gibt es einige Highlights - selbst, wenn man "Tap-Water" bestellt, hat es ein paar Kräuter und ein Fruchtstück drin.

J'ai essayé ce Resto sous recommandation de TripAdvisor et je n'ai pas été déçu!! Les plats sont excellents avec une carte très bien fourni avec toutes les spécialités indiennes. Le cadre est soigné et le service tip-top !! Précisez tout de même si vous voulez des plats moins relevés en piment. On s'est cassé le bide !!

We visited this restaurant last night. This was the most delicious Indian meals we have ever eaten. The menu is extensive and varied and caters for all tastes of Indian cuisine. We had the mixed platter (for 2) to start and this was absolutely delicious. For mains we had chicken tikka masala and lamb raganjosh, both wonderful and filling. And finished with a beautiful desert. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. I listened in to other diner's commenting on their meal and all was positive. We will certainly go back here.

Simply put ive never been so eager to experiment with new dishes, foods and spices and was never disapointed. A real journey and a delightfull one at that.The setting was delightfull and the staff where most helpfull. We had the great advantage that we where a large group so we almost got to taste the whole menue which was great. And as mentioned the food was divine. And I have to admit that I am an absolute carnivore but the vegetarian dishes really did it for me as well and it gave me an idea of how or why people would go veg.

This was the best Indian fine dine restaurant during our 4 week EuroTrip. Though we only tried a couple of Indian places but nothing beats the food at this place. Very authentic and the staff is very friendly. The owner Akshay is a real good person and it was very nice of him to spend some time taking to us as well as offer some complementary food and drinks. Highly recommend this place for great food, ambiance and hospitality.Thanks Akshay.Rohit (saddlebug.com)

This place is so nice :) the food was delicious and the staff was very attentive. For the price, the dishes are pretty large and fulfilling. The desserts and Indian tea are nice as well (after a big meal, tea was great!).

Auch kurzfristig war es möglich für abends einen Tisch draussen zu erhalten, es war sehr hübsch dekoriert und unser Kellner war höchst freundlich und witzig, der Service sehr unaufdringlich. Der Vorspeisen-Salat mit Tandoori-Chicken sehr lecker und mit frischen Johannisbeeren dekoriert. Die Hauptspeisen wurden nach Bestellung entsprechend gewürzt, das Thalis scheint vom Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis am besten zu sein: 3 vegetarische Speisen plus ein Dhal, Raita, Naan, kleiner Reis und sogar noch ein Gulab Jamun als Dessert. Enttäuschend war der hohe Preis für das südindische Chicken mit schwarzem Pfeffer, Zimt, Curry-Blatt und Kokos für CHF 33.-, allerdings OHNE jegliche Beilage, Naturreis kostet nochmals CHF 4.50 extra. Für zwei Personen, die sich eine Vorspeise teilen, zwei Hauptgerichte und nur alkoholfreie Getränke belief sich schlussendlich die Rechnung auf über CHF 115.-.Auf der Homepage des Restaurants kann man die Menükarte herunterladen!
Locale simpatico dove si possono gustare specialita' della cucina indiana ben cucinate e ben presentate. Servizio efficiente. Prezzi adeguati al mercato svizzero. Consigliabile la prenotazione.

My husband n I visited this place angain after couple of months and guess wat?It was amazing like always.. This tym we tried new dish Rajasthani Ragda Meat with onion chilli paratha .. it was so delicious.. and then as a topping we tried their new desert Boondi Parfait.. Aahhh ... I wonder how can they be so amazing.. Everything is so perfect and new all the tym .. Right from the music to the deco .. everything is just Admirable...If you are in Zurich and never visited this place then you really missed something pertinent

Das Essen ist eigentlich ganz in Ordnung und die Bedienung einigermassen freundlich (mal abgesehen davon, dass niemand deutsch kann und ausschliesslich auf englisch bedient wird). Was bleibt ist der schale Geschmack der Rechnung: viel zu teuer! Ein Curry kostet um die 35 Franken, den Reis dazu muss man für 6.50 extra bezahlen!
Great Indian restaurant near Oerlikon, also easily accessible by tram e.g line 14. Has few tables outside. Great selection of Indian dishes!

I tried paneer tak a tak and kadai paneer last week and food was delicious. I travelled many places in europe and tried different Indian restaurants, I rank Tamarind as number one. Service is outstanding and staff is very friendly. At this place you can find true test of Indian food.
I love Indian food and this place was a big hit. I have ordered the tak a tak and 2nd time the dansaak. The chicken curry was also delicious. Try the garlic nan it's the best.

Het ligt best wel even uit het centrum, maar wel nabij een tramhalte. Zeer lekkere en zeer mooi geserveerde thali gegeten (de soep er voor was ook lekker, maar had naar hoeveelheid toe, niet gehoeven). Vriendelijk personeel en ook een origineel ingerichtte setting, beetje mysterieus. Absoluut de wat verdere verplaatsing waard!

If you're in the mood for Indian Food, Tamarind Hill will not disappoint. The menu is pricy but so is everything else in Zurich. We enjoyed everything we got and the portions were quite large. For two people we got two entrees, a bryani and naan and it was probably too much food. The one drawback is the location. If you are staying in the city center you will have to take a taxi or public transportation to and from and there is nothing else to do in the area. But if you're craving some chicken tikka you won't go home disappointed.
I can truly recommand this restaurant! The place is charming, the stuff is very friendly and the food is just amazing!!

Akshay and his team have done a fantastic job of taking a run down location in a not really 'hip' part of town and transforming it into Zürich's best Indian restaurant by far. And coming from an Indian, who loves the food and who had to resort to learning how to cook after moving here and not finding a single half-decent Indian place, that's really a compliment. Yes, the food is not as spicy as the Indian palate would like but all the different spices are very much there though a bit dialed down. The Rogan Josh and the Ginger Iced Tea are fantastic! And the service is top notch - a far cry from the usual Indian places with disinterested wait staff and horrible ambience. Here, the owner and all the wait staff will go out of their way to make you feel at home, give recommendations based on your taste and spice levels and have multiple small touches (the berries in the water!) to really make this a special place to visit. Prices are high, but then this is Zürich and frankly, given the effort put in to this place, they are well worth it

After visiting few other indian restaurants in Zurich, we landed at Tamarind Hill and were floored by the food, ambience, customer service, attention to details and above all the smiles they carried around while serving which was awesome. I truly congratulate Tamarind Hill for such a great food and ambience (as I understand they opened a year back) that makes Indian Food taste and look the best. We tried Tikka Masala, Hara Bara Kabab, Chicken Soup, Chicken Biryani, etc. etc. One must visit Tamarind if in Zurich. Exceeded Expectations. Sanjay Arora from the Bay Area- California

Once more Tamarind Hill surprised with new drinks and new dishes, exceeding expectations!Try: Rajastani Ragda or Chicken Almond & coconut as main courses and for dessert: Boondo Parfait - simply scrumptious. And if you are lucky you get the warm hearted, friendly attention of Sayra (all staff members are very firendly though)and enjoy a lovely and memorable evening. LD
didnot like the naan or any of the breads..as they were like papads..too crispy.. chicken and curry was great but bread was imperfect.

Had amazing dinner with family. It is one of the best Indian restaurants we have eaten in a long time. The malai kofta and chicken tak tak were just out of this world with the correct amount of spice and cooked to perfection. Special thanks to Saira for her menu suggestions which were right on target based on our taste preferences. Prices were also reasonable compared to what we have seen recently in the rest of Switzerland. All in all a dinner to remember for our family!
Num lugar muito escondido e não fácil de chegar, este restaurante modesto tem uma das melhores culinárias que já provei. Recomendo com empenho.

Omg!!! The perfect taste, great ambiance and amazing service.. what more can u ask for.. butter chicken was excellent, Ragda meat and Malai tikka were delicious. In the middle of Zurich, a gem found!!! Loved it!!

This was one of the best Indian food I have tried. It was cooked to perfection. The owner paid great attention & it was worth the trip. It's right off a tram stop. Easy access. Even the dessert was delicious.Dont miss it if in Zurich

Wir waren seit ein paar Monaten nicht mehr im Tamarind Hill. Leider hat alles extrem nachgelassen. Die Speisekarten fallen total auseinander - das geht bei diesen hohen Preisen gar nicht. Der Service war gut und freundlich. Das Essen grad mal knapp okey.Schade! Preis - Leistung passt für uns so nicht mehr!
Sehr guet ich liebe es bin zum erste mal hier aber wird nicht so bleiben das essen ist Hammer! #bestindianinzurich
Very pleasant people, very helpful when choosing meals. Dressed very well! Wonderful presentation. Some novel serving ideas.
After our first days hectic tour we settled for an indian dinner at Tamarind.. A very soothing ambience..a perfect punjabi taste...warm hospitality from hotel management interns...
Köstliches Essen und super freundlicher, aufmerksamer Service. Kann beim Essen nicht bemängeln. Es war alles hervorragend!
Was there on a saturday night and it was great armosphere Loved the food and very polite service Cant wait to be back .
Really enjoyed our evening .... the food was delicious and extremely friendly service The setting is great and very comfortable

Nice food.. decent hospitality. Good service.. tram station 20 meters away .guests are mostly Indians that gives a feel it simply serves traditional Indian food rather than being touristic.. meals are light and well digested. I loved the pickled onions and the pickle jar at the table.. attendant offers suggestions.. I also loved the hot Indian tea/chai which is prepared with milk and spices.. I loved it and would go there again..
We've eaten here four or five times and it is consistently good. Service is great, drinks are super. It's a nice place to take guests when the weather is good- we enjoy sitting outside.

This place is a 3min walk from my home and I have been there when it was still a buffet and later even an Irish pub. This was my first time to visit it as a regular à la carte restaurant. We had a veggie and chicken Thali. The food was rich in taste and we were happy with the portion. It came with both bread and rice and dessert. The only thing we are less happy about is the fact that water is not just water. It is water with mint and orange and pomegranate in it. We could not see if it was tap water or not (because it came in a carafe), therefore 11chf is too much. The service is good with very friendly waiters. There was also live music at some point which was nice.

Extrem freundlicher und aufmerksamer Service. Als Liebhaber der indischen Küche hat uns das Essen jedoch etwas enttäuscht. Die Auswahl an Speisen ist sehr gut, aber es leider fehlte an Geschmack! Hinzu kommt, dass die Gerichte viel zu teuer sind. Bei 32 CHF für ein vegetarisches Menu (relativ kleine Portion) stimmt das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis nicht. Reis muss auch noch zusätzlich bezahlt werde. Schade für das schöne Restaurant.

We are Indian food snobs to some extent and thought the food here was excellent. I have always loved lamb roganjosh and have been frequently disappointed when ordering this dish. This time the dish was outstanding. The naan was yummy along with the chutney. All in all, the four of us thought the food was great.The only downside was the 'restaurant pour' of wine we received. In any case, we would definitely visit Tamarind Hill again if we are ever back to Zurich.

One of the best Indian food in Zurich with nice centrally location. Good food with friendly staff and excellent service. They have their own parking too. We rally enjoyed food there. Highly recommended place for Indian food in Zurich.
The butter chicken and the lamb roganjosh were the best I had , compared to even few of the good restaurants in India .... will be back again and highly recommend

Kamen an einem Samstag Abend spontan vorbei und konnten gerade den letzten Tisch draussen ergattern. Wurden freundlich empfangen und aufmerksam bedient. Das Essen war super gut. Draussen zu sitzen war an diesem Abend sehr angenehm und es war zudem sehr ruhig (nicht viel Strassenverkehr). Waren mit Kind da. Es gab auch Kindermenu und gute Empfehlungen was Kinder essen können. Wir kommen gerne wieder.
delicious food i was going by tram amd saw it so i tried it and it made me feel full with portion they serve
The restautant food is good but is very expensive. They charge lot of money for Water as well. Worst part is they accept EURO at work with Frank. So if you have euro you will end up paying 10% extra.
Such a lovely surprise to find a delicious Indian restaurant in Zurich. Congratulations for a truly authentic and delicious experience
the best chicken tikka and in the main course i had the malai kofta . it was gorgeous and service very nice . highly recommend

One of the best indian food I have ever had. I would say even better than in India when it comes to their Malai Kofta. A must order!!! Service was friendly and efficient. Food was great. Its rated top indian restaurant in zurich and totally deserves that title.

We had a very nice evening at the restaurant with a tasty entree and main course. The staff was also very friendly and the place had a nice atmosphere. We will come back.(We had the tikka masala lamb and tandoori chicken butter with garlic naan and mixed rice)

Now you can create your own lunch box menu from a choice of starters, several curries (available as vegetarian, various meats or fish) and various Indian breads. It's all neatly presented in a special tray and includes salad, mint sauce and rice. It's great value for money, especially considering the choices you have, the generous portions and last but not least, the quality. If you need to spice up your limited lunch time options elsewhere, you should really give the lunch here a try! With the whole 'create your own' concept, you can return again and again to try out the various combinations. Lastly, this concept also makes it easier if you're accompanied by so-called 'pickier eaters' because there's something for everyone (and even some European dishes if necessary). All I can say is if you want impress your work colleagues or friends, this is the place to go for lunch!

Its very difficult to find good Indian food in Switzerland!The restaurants are very expensive and the food is kind of OK. Not good!We found this restaurant after looking at many restaurants in the vicinity.The menu is kind of very short with very less choices!
Accueil prévenant, cuisine excellente et variée pour un souper sur une terrasse inattendue. À recommander absolument.
Gist of all the amazing experience I had Warm and cozy environment Nice decor comfy chairs Food was fantastic Special thanks to Kimbereli and Saria for the fab service. Will visit again for sure.

My husband and I lived many years in London and developed the 'tradition' of visiting a great Indian restaurant each Friday...One recent Friday we thought, it would be great to find such an authentic experience in Zurich. If that is what you are looking for, look no further. The food was high quality and the service attentive as well as friendly. We will definitely be back.

After touring Europe for 20 days I came across this amazing restaurant... such a warm hospitality and the food was really delicious... it was like eating in a very fancy yet so warm placeI would recommend the malai kofta and the dal makhani .... it was the best I had so far

We had the best okra and butter chicken. The homemade lychee mint tea is very refreshing. Service was prompt and very friendly. Love that they are very warm towards all guests - locals and visitors. Can't wait to return.
We had the best Okra for a long time! Highly recommended. Also, they have very tasty homemade ice teas.
Im a regular here and they never fail to impress.they always have something new and exciting in the menu and i love the atmosphere and service

Don't judge a book by its cover. This place com the outside does not look like much. But once you step inside you will be greeted by such welcoming staff, you know you are in for a great evening. Very tantalizing menu however ask your waitstaff for suggestions on what to get, the portion sizes, etc. this was of tremendous help and ate like pigs. Well worth it.
Trotz online Reservation, kein Tisch frei gehabt und würden unfreundlich behandelt also ignoriert.Zum Glück gab es Alternative.
Très bonne cuisine indienne. Service impeccable. Accueil très sympa. Bon conseil lors de la commande

As I got off the tram stop, I was presented with a colourful outdoor seating area adorned with butterflies and lanterns - which made me pleased before I even sat down to eat. (I noticed that it caught the attention of many passers by too!) The staff were focussed and friendly and one could feel their hospitality was genuine. As dark fell, the myriad of lights came on inside and it was beautiful (& has very comfy, grand chairs!) The food was simply delicious and plentiful and the chai tea was brought in a clay cup. The service was personal and dietary requirements met. Quality for money with a perfect setting! I would love to be there when there is live music! :-)

Wir waren zu Muttertag das erste Mal im Tamarind und es gab sogar Livemusic.Das Restaurant ist nett eingerichtet, nicht so wie üblich, aber uns hat es gefallen.Der Service war sehr schnell und aufmerksam und unser Hund hat sofort eine Schale mit Wasser bekommen.Als Vorspeise gab es "King prawn zaffrani", die 3 Riesengarnelen waren sehr gut, die Kartoffelmasse hätte etwas gewürzt sein können.Als Hauptspeise gab es Vegetarian Thali und Paneer Butter Masala. Beide Portionen waren vollkommen ausreichend, beim Paneer bestellte ich noch eine Portion Reis und q Butter Naan. Alles war sehr lecker und schmackhaft, die Schärfe war auch vorhanden.Einzig der Preis, wir bezahlten ca. 100 CHF ist doch recht hoch, für Zürich wohl üblich.Wir kommen auf jeden Fall nochmal wieder, danke für den schönen und leckeren Abend.
Was there with my friends on a saturday night Loved the food and the ambience Staff super proffesional and really helpful
It was like a little paradise inside with all the beautifully dressed staff Amazing music and delicious food Can't wait to go back again Recommend the thali
Meget meget god mad! God service og glade mennesker. De er dygtige og meget autentisk. Kan kun anbefales
Rigtig spændende mad - smagsoplevelse til selv de kræsne, super venlig betjening og hyggelig atmosfære - kan varmt anbefales

Sohnemann wollte an seinem Geburtstag unbedingt indische Küche und hier sind wir gelandet! Wir hatten einen schönen Abend und das Essen war sehr gut: Chicken Thali, Khadai, Tikka Masala, Palak und Nilgiri mit Fisch - alles wunderbar ubd alle happy.
Great and authentic indiandinner in a beautiful, relaxing place. Good music in the background (Sade), very friendly staff and owner! Thank you for this evening! We loved it will come back soon!
Sehr gutes indisches Essen. Super food, big portions! Delivered hot and fresh from the kitchen. Staffs are very nice and friendly. Great value for money! 😊

The food is of outstanding quality and both the Vindaloo and the Goan Fish curry tasted completely authentic. The service was also great.Given the high quality of both the food and service whilst not cheap, but is certainly great value for the money.Highly recommend the experience if you want authentic Indian food in Zurich

I really enjoyed this restaurant and the indian dishes. We had 4 different dishes and all were very tasty. Very friendly service. Strangely enough all dressed in saris but no Indians...One of the best indian food restaurants I have visited in Zurich. Don't go if you want to save as the average main dish price around 34.-CHF. A bit on the small side, but loads of atmosphere. I think you need a reservation otherwise a long wait. On Saturdays there are musician/ singers (pop music),with a bar so a bit loud. Not a place for a really quiet discussion. Some parking, and tables outside in the summer so probably a fun place. And you can bring your children and dog!
Had a fantastic meal with my girlfriend Amazing food and the friendliest service i have experienced in zurich Beautiful setting .... will be back soon

Das Tamarind ist Sehr gemütlich eingerichtet mit bequemen Stühle und romantischer Beleuchtung! Die Bedienung war sehr freundliche und zuvorkommend! Das Essen schmeckte sehr authentisch, vermutlich wurde allerdings der Schärfegrad dem europäischen Gaumen angepasst! Sehr solide, nichts aufregendes!
sehr gute Küche von der Vorspeise bis zum Dessert, auch in der Weihnachtszeit flinke Bedienung, gemütliche Atmosshäre, das Restaurant ist nicht überladen dekoriert
We really enjoyed the dinner. Very nice flavours, right spicy level and good service. Price is little bit high for Zurich standards. But it is worthy to go

Excellent food, wonderful staff.. Not sure which one is better... We started going there (sometimes take away as well) almost as soon as they were open.. It's quite some time now, Akshay made sure that same quality is maintained after years..

Really excellent well presented meal this evening in Oerlikon, just outside of Zurich. Everything was more than excellent hence the high rating. Only recommendation would be to avoid the chicken samosas that were really ordinary and that appeared to be mass produced and tasteless. Stick with the better vegetable versions. Food though was with that exception outstanding. Will be back.
Deserves the number 1 rating.the best butterchicken i ever had and their homemade oreo icecream Cant wait to be back again !!!
the best indian restaurant in switzerland.the meal was fantastic and the service was great .definately highly reccomend.well done for being the number 1 restaurant in zurich. well deserved.......
We had a very good dinner here. The food was very good. It was not extremely spicy but it still had some kick to it. The service was friendly and very accommodating to our young children.
Die beste Küche ist wertlos, wenn man auf die Reservierung per Internet trotz zweiter Nachfrage keine Antwort bekommt. Zum Glück gibt es in Zürich auch andere gute Restaurants.

Hier gibt es hervorragendes indisches Essen. Alles sieht sehr ansprechend aus und schmeckt sehr gut. Es gibt auch viele Gerichte die man von anderen indischen Restaurants nicht kennt. Der Service ist sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Leider sprechen sie fast ausschliesslicht nur Englisch. Wir verfügen zwar über gute Englischkenntnisse aber trotzdem habe ich ein wenig Mühe damit, wenn ich in einem Restaurant in Zürich Englisch sprechen muss. Das Lokal ist sehr farbig eingerichtet mit dem Hang zum kitsch aber es passt.

Went there because it had a No.1 rating on TA. Too be honest I was not so enthusiastic as many of the people who have left their reviews before me. The food was good but too salty for my liking, as well in starter as in main.Staff was nice and helpful.
Tamarind Hill has an amazing staff, very helpful, entertaining and stylish. Great chef and food & also live music. Would rate it 6 star if I could. :)
Einmal mehr einfach nur ausgezeichnet und mehr als nur gut! Das Essen, der Service und die Getränke sind wirklich etwas vom Besten in ganz Zürich! Hingehen! Unbedingt!
Testé deux fois pour le déjeuner. Excellent sur tous les plans. Nourriture indienne exquise et copieuse, service charmant, prix abordables. Rare de trouver une telle qualité à Zurich.

I am not an authentic Indian food lover... but Tamarind made me (slightly) change my mind.The menu offers a broad selection of Indian dishes, including good vegetarian options. We had a chicken samosa, as a starter, followed by lamb kebab and lamb roganjosh... all very well cooked and presented. Quality of food and mix of spices and flavors were just perfect.Service was very careful and attentive, precise and supportive.The atmosphere is really nice and typical. Good prices.

Went there for my birthday with my friends .we were a group of 16 people and i must say everyone complemented on the food and service Thanks to tamarind hill team for making my day so special!!@@@ Highly recommend
Loved the brunch and the indian tapas menu We were given vodka water balls complimentary....they were to die for Definitely recommend the oreo ice-cream

Went their with my partner for the second time . Amazing food and very friendly service!! Must compliment the owner for really giving a personal touch Loved the thali and the biryani which my partner ordered

Tamarind is an ok Indian restaurant, but there is absolutely nothing exceptional about the food and it is definitely not deserving of the top place on Trip Advisor. If you are in Zurich for a few days, do not waste your time - you are likely to be disappointed.

What makes this restaurant is not only the food, but the ambience, staff and service you experience. We visit Tamarind on a regular basis with my daughter, she absolutely adores Kimberly and her great personable nature.The Tamarini team are incredible and am so happy that we found this place. This'll be a gem for as long as we live in Zurich, food is awesome.

Just got back from a great dinner! I had the vegetarian meal with three different dishes. The food was really good and the service was great. It's a very good place to bring your date to if you want.I will definitely come back here for some other dishes.

Spent one night in Zurich and were craving Indian food. TripAdvisor said Tamarind Hill is great so we reached there!The owner Akash is very courteous as is the rest of the staff. His recommendations were spot on and the food was really delicious! The Dal, malai kofta and the palak paneer were all too good!The ambiance is very good and the atmosphere is very comfortable. On the whole, highly recommended!

Die gemischte Vorspeiseplatte kostete ein bisschen (CHF 24,50), aber sie war reichhaltig und sehr, sehr lecker! Die folgenden Hauptspeisen (Lamm Roganjosh, Butter Chicken) waren qualitativ ebenso hochstehend und die Beilagen (Naan, Reis) erfreulich authentisch. Alles in allem ein schönes, kulinarisches Erlebnis, das durch den aufmerksamen Service und das angenehme Ambiente abgerundet wurde. Eine Fahrt nach Oerlikon, die sich absolut gelohnt hat - gerne bald wieder. :-)

My Wife and I decided to visit for a meal after seeing the TripAdvisor reviews - we are really glad that we did! We are both British and really miss having a good curry in Switzerland. This was one of the best Indian meals we have ever had, anywhere. The service was very friendly and efficient too. We live in Zug but will definitely be making the trip to eat there again very soon.The dishes we chose for both the starters and mains were very tasty. If there was one thing that would make it even better would be to offer a broader range of dishes / curries. My favorite starter is a king prawn puri but this was not offered and neither was my favorite curry -a chicken bhuna. I will ask whether there are plans to extend the menu the next time we visit.
Amazing malai kofta ... the best I had so far .... and I must compliment the waitress serving us.... Saira ... thanks for a lovely evening !!!!
Beautifully decorated with smartly dressed staff in typical Indian attire Enjoyed the live music and the food was to die for .

Was once again in Zürich and had to re visit this restaurant.... I must say .... once again an amazing professional service and amazing food .My clients were so impressed that they rebooked the restaurant on the same dayKeep it up guys .... can't wait to be back again !!!!

Das Essen ist sehr lecker! Und so richtig indisch. Das sieht man auch an den Indern, die hier essen. Die Dekoration ist üppig und typisch indisch! Der Service sehr aufmerksam, spricht aber fast nur englisch. Die Preise sind Zürich- Standart.

Hatte schon gedacht das dat lecker wird.Service traditionell gekleidet und sehr zu vorkommend.Das grade abends das Lokal sehr gut gebucht ist, unbedingt tisch bestellen.Trotz Bestellung Warte Zone an der Theke- bekommst aber keine kostenloses warte Getränk.Wir hatten an diesem Samstagabend super Livemusik.Leider Vorspeise nur Fritte – hätte besser sein können. Teilweise zu lange frittiert.Hauptspeise war echt lecker- also wer auf die Indische Küche steht sollte hier unbedingt mal vorbeischauen. Preis für 2 Personen Getränke Vorspeise, Haupt Spies 120 chf-Liegt also im Mittelfeld.

The food in Tamarind Hill is simply delicious! Wise choice when it comes pocking up an authentic Indian restaurant in Zurich. The service is adequate and staff were always ready to guiding you picking up the right dish for you. Would definitely visit this place again!

I had a great experience here not only because of the delicious and authentic cuisine but also the excellent service. Their friendliness and attention to detail is almost without parallel in Zürich and I can safely say, it's one of the top restaurants here.
The food was very disappointing no flavour tasteless curry. Chicken thali was cold and no flavour service and decoration were the best bits but the food does not deserve such a high rating.
Delicious food with a high level of attention to detail. We felt well taken care of at all times. Great ambiance and live music.

Many visits over the last year, staff friendly and relational, always made to feel at home , special , food is top quality , so unique and very tasty, top quality Indian food and certainly the best in Zurich for sure

I went to this restaurant on recommendation from some Indian expats living in Zurich who were all praise about it. I must admit, I had rather high expectations which were not met. The restaurant had a strange arrangement like a pub with high pub stools and dining area around it. That made it really crowded, there was very little space between the neighbouring tables. The background music was rather loud and made conversation difficult. On top of it, one could easily hear people talking on tables next to you than the one sitting opposite you. We ordered mango lassi as we always do when we try a new Indian restaurant in Switzerland. I would say it was rather thin and with faint hint of mango, it could have been refreshing on a hot summer day but I have to admit, I have had better and richer mango lassis in other Indian restaurants in Switzerland. Our starters were beautifully presented and tasted OK. What we missed totally with the starters was chutneys, sauces. They were there in very small quantities more like food decoration than something you could enjoy as a dip. Our table was a bit wobbly and I had to ask twice to the staff to put a filling under the table so that it stablizes. They finally did it. By then, I was already feeling disillusioned about the whole experience but was surprized how full the restaurant was. It seems indeed it is a very popular restaurant in the area with some Indian families and majority of locals. My vegetarian main course was good but not exactly rich and flavourful as they describe themselves on the website: authentic and richly flavourful indian meals. Though my partner was satisfied with his meat dish. We did not try any desserts. I walked out wondering whether I would go there again.

What a wonderful dinner! We did not expect to have such delicious food on our plate in Zuerich. Living in South East Asia we know how good Indian food can taste, but we didn't expect this nice little restaurant to serve us such a delight! Service was immaculate! Very friendly!

I have been here twice for dinner in the past three months. My impression of the restaurant was excellent on both occasions. Nice setting, very good service, and fantastic food. In terms of spiciness it's probably more like an Indian restaurant in the UK than your normal continental place, so a Vindaloo here is spicy. It's a good level though that doesn't burn your tongue and gum on the first bite. Very tasty! I'll definitely go back. The fact that it attracts a lot of Indians is also a good sign.Booking in the evening recommended.
It's an experience! The food - the service ! Worth visiting every time I come to Zurich- something is always complimentary!

Wow. Absolutely incredible food, authentic Indian cuisine and atmosphere, stopped here before a concert with my girlfriend and was not disappointed!! Fairly pricey but I could see why! Very friendly staff also, will definitely be coming back!

Super service with smartly dressed staff, knowledgable about the food they served.Funky atmosphere, loved the VIP corner.Food served looking tantalisingly good.Very authentic and tasty. Butter chicken- superbCheeky spicy chutney for starters was surprisingly teasing to the palateChai served in clay glasses, what a touch.Will be back for sure. Now, keep it up, next time you may get 5 stars if this is the case !

What an amazing eveningWe were a group of 9 people and were visiting Zurich while we were on holidays . Half of us were vegetarians so we had limited options of going out to different restaurantsWe walked into tamarind hill on a Tuesday night but it was completely full , we had to wait for 40 minutes before we could get a table but we enjoyed their lovely cocktails at the bar !!!The food was well worth waiting ....I never had a malai kofta that tasty even in Pakistan and the aloo tikka was to die for .I had no space left to eat more but the lovely waitress offered me a complimentary dessert as we were waiting for so long for a table .The caramel pudding was soooooo delicious .... when the plate came it was so beautiful that I didn't want to eat it ...Amazing night and thanks to all the lovely staff!!!!
Fantastic evening. Wonderful food and great service. The live music was sensational. Can't wait to go again.

Établissement proposant une cuisine indienne de qualité avec, à la clef, une belle carte. Les portions sont relativement généreuses permettant de se limiter au plat. Seul bémol pour cet établissement: la mauvaise insonorisation.
Wow.... glad to have the people like you all..loved the way they served..amzing food..you guy are rocking ...Thank you ...🍝🍛🍜
Köstliches Essen bei original indischem Ambiente. Wir empfehlen das vegetarische Thali. Bedienung top und Parkplätze vor der Tür.Wir sind zufrieden, Daumen hoch!
Uma casa com uma comida maravilhosa indiana, ambiente familiar. Bom atendimento, Recomendo !!!!!!! Volte sempre.

Distinctly average indian food, we were so disappointed. TripAdvisor rating was excellent overall so had really high expectations. We were sadly let down. Starters were luke warm, mains were obviously spiced up with chilli powder rather than properly balanced. Won't be back!

Your baby's 1st birthday is a big milestone and as first time parents you want nothing but the BEST! We chose Tamarind Hill for the grand celebration and they did a commendable job exceeding our expectations. The decorations and set up, finger licking starters and an array of sumptuous food, extremely cooperative and customer oriented staff, convenient location and much more is indeed supreme class quality. We would HIGHLY recommend Tamarind Hill for your celebrations without a doubt especially if you want to relax as guests in spite of being the hosts ;)

This ressie is a short ride on Shanks' mare from Oerlikon train station.The exterior is a little spartan, but walk through the door and you are in another world.A very Indian world.In a good way.The service is attentative, but not off-puttingly so, the wine selection is ample and the food arrived promptly.And the food was so so so good.We had an amazing night.We tried the take out service a few weeks later, simply gastly, we actually threw it in the bin.

Ate here whilst on business in Zurich. I had just returned from India and was missing the food! Had an excellent Chicken Korma (which was more spicy than Korma usually is). Waiting staff were super friendly and attentive. Will definitely eat here again.

Wir sind einmal mehr begeistert und würden immer wieder hierher kommen. Wir machen hier Regelmässig Musik und freuen uns jedesmal vorallem auf das Essen. Das Essen schmeckt vorzüglich. Wenn man reinkommt spürt man, dass alles mit Liebe gemacht wurde.

Alles tip top. Super freundliche Bedienung. Sehr leckeres essen. 5/5, nichts zu beanstanden. Bis zum nächsten mal!Everything fine. Super friendly service. Very delicious food. 5/5, nothing to complain about. Until next time!

I haven't had Indian food for a while. Somehow the Indian restaurant located in Luzern is still the best I have had in Switzerland.Anyway, the restaurant is great. First, I have to say they have strange price standard and portion. We are two, ordered two starters and two main courses, can't finish them and even full like hell. Just don't do it... the starter is almost same portion as the main course with half the price so guess what I will recommend order two starters insteadAh one more point, probably it was Friday, so they have maybe too many part time waiters and waitresses, which makes them have nothing to do lol. So they just keep coming around and take whatever they can from your table and keep asking you if everything is ok. At the end, even wanna take the empty glasses while we are talking lol. So we just paid and left.Recommend food: chicken tikka, butter chicken, tandoori chicken, garlic naanNot recommend: ginger ice tea, unless you are the super fan of ginger, then you can get to drench into it.

We were a group of friends craving for an Indian when tamarind hill popped up on trip advisor What a night .... awesome service , fantastic food and compliments for the music Was my second visit but already planning the next !!!! Superb!!!😍

After all the reviews, my wife and I were expecting a delicious indian dinner, just to be clear we did take away this time.We order the tamarind lamb fry, it was too sweet for my taste. We also ordered chicken Vindaloo and chicken Tandoori, even when we were warned by phone that the Vindaloo dish was spicy, one thing that characterized it was the lack of it.We will try the restaurant again but definitely not take away.

My boyfriend and me had dinner in this beautiful restaurant for his birthday. I can say that I had one of the best culinary experience I have ever had! The food was delicious and the atmosphere very characteristic and cozy. But what really made the different was the perfect service!! The staff was extremely qualified, kind and welcoming. I would recommend this restaurant 100%. I had a wonderful night with my boyfriend and I can not wait to come back to this restaurant to have another amazing Indian night in Zurich!

We chose this restaurant as it was accessible by tram from our hotel and had generally favourable reviews on Tripadvisor, and because we love Indian food. I rather doubt that we will return to Zurich but if I did would certainly dine here again.The decor is a bit mad, in a good way, and the atmosphere in a fully booked restaurant on a Friday evening was buzzy but not obtrusive. The owner/manager greeted us warmly and we were well attended to by the colourfully clad waitresses and smart waiters. If anything, the food arrived a little too quickly for my liking but not everyone is looking for a long, relaxed evening. I did not, however, feel that they were rushing us out the door.The prices seemed steep until we had experienced a day or two in Zurich and realised that (at least for post-Brexit vote Sterling) everything is very expensive. In fact their prices were comparatively reasonable, especially for the excellent draft beer.Had we known just how generously portioned the Thalis are we would not have bothered with starters, which were fine and nicely presented but nothing special taste-wise. The Thalis were exceptional, however, being not only plentiful but really delicious (without being over-spicy) and nicely presented. I am a very big eater but couldn't finish my lamb thali.A great atmosphere, good value, attentive and smiling service, delicious food and a tram stop straight to our hotel. What more could you want? Highly recommended.
These guys here are amazing!! Great food, good ambience and very friendly and personable staff! This is my 4th time here and each experience has been better than before!
Tried many restaurants here. This one did all right, ambiente, food and service! Wow! I highly recommend to any one...

Excellent Restaurant in Zurich. We have been to several other indian restaurants in zurich as well but this one is best in all aspects. worth visiting and value for money ofcourse. I love the staff as they are full of warmth and wud assist you in chosing menu, helping with kids and ofcourse will surprise you with complimentary things too.Definitely it has become my favourite place and one n only choice for indian food in zurich.Thank you Tamarind staff, for being so nice.All the best

Tamarind Hill makes Indian food exciting, serving innovative food such as Tamarind lamb, Saffron King prawns and more, food that is rarely seen in Indian restaurants in Zurich. The staff were excellent - friendly and offered good recommendations for our meal. The chef took my 3 year old sons's request for lamb in the children's menu and made his version of lamb makhni, which was a hit with my son. Overall, an extremely enjoyable experience, I highly recommend Tamarind Hill.

A MUST Indian Cuisine to visit in Zurich.We did call few hours of our anniversary evening dinner and staff went overboard with decorations to make our evening memorable.The ambience, food quality, service and staff friendliness was awesome. We HIGHLY RECOMMEND the place if you like to experience Indian food.

This is definitively a very good restaurant. The service is perfect, the room is nice and the food wonderful. The only down point is that it is under spicy for Indian food. Don't hesitate to ask for spicier dish. I t is not expensive for Zürich and the quality makes it a very good quality/price factor.
Was there on Valentine night,,, the restaurant looked so romantic and the food was Amazing.....Highly recommend !!!!!!
Went there with my 2 children and my husband . What a great evening ... they even had a kids menu and the waitress serving us was super friendly Will be back with my girlies !!! ❤️

I visited the restaurant on a saturday night with my partner and her family .The minute you enter the restaurant had a wow factor , extremely polite service and the food was mind blowingWe tried the bytter chicken and the roganjosh and they were the best i had so farWould definitely highly reccomend it !!!!

Une magnifique soirée passée au Tamarind Hill, un service de qualité avec des employés souriants et proactifs ainsi que des plats vous permettant de découvrir différentes spécialités indiennes.Vraiment excellents. On reviendra!Côté prix, dans la norme, tout dépend de vos choix... (apéritif, nombre de plats, vins, etc.)

Aufgrund der hohen Bewertung freuten wir uns sehr auf den Abend. Jedoch enttäuschte uns das Restaurant.. die Vorspeise wurde erst nach einer Stunde serviert, da sie uns vergessen hatten und das Servicepersonal war schlichtweg unhöflich. Meiner Meinung nach sind die Preise selbst für Zürich zu hoch und wir werden den Abend leider nicht positiv in Erinnerung behalten.

Nous sommes allés en couple dans ce restaurant et avons été très bien acceuillis. La nourriture était très bonne (nous avons pris du poulet au curry ainsi que le Tandoori Butter Chicken). L'ambiance est aussi agréable. Nous le recommandons.

I went with my boyfriend for Valentine's day. It was an unexpected surprise the fixed menu. but it was an extremely nice surprise. Aphrodisiac indian menu for two. Then everything in a extremely romantic athmosphere.

Super schônnes Ambiente, sehr freundliche und aufmerksame Bedienung. Dass essen war wunderbar aber auch die drinks sind sehr fein und schônn angerichtet. Das beste indische Restaurant in der schweiz. Wir kommen gerne wieder.
Ambiance, Food, Service ! Excellent !! From the time u walk in till you leave , you are taken care of like royalty ! Thank you ALL at Tamarind Hill!
An awesome service.. love it! Had the chicken thali and a mango lassi, very tasty and fair price.. we'll be back!
Wir haben in der VIP- Ecke gegessen und waren vom Essen, von der Bedienung wie auch von der gemütlichen Atmosphäre begeistert. Wir kommen wieder
Awesome place, excellent customer service, I recommend to visit this place for birthday celebrations. Great food.. Joel(møjø jøjø)

We shared three main dishes, vegeterian, prawns and chicken for three. Portions are generous. Tasty and different. The main dish doesn't include rice/naan, so it ends up being a little more expensive than first look but 50CHF without alcoholic drinks.Service very attentive and the ambience is relaxed. Enjoyed the evening!

Super Essen, schön eingerichtet, freundliche Bedienung, sauber, viele Einheimische, guten Wein.Ich habe in Zürich wohl jedes indische Restaurant ausprobiert - Tamarind Hill toppt sie alle.Gerne immer wieder!

Ich war mit meiner Liebsten letzten Samstag Abend im Tamarind Hill. Wir lieben die indische Küche und waren neugierig, ob die hohen Ratings im Tripadvisor gerechtfertigt sind. Wir wurden nicht enttäuscht. Die Vorspeisen-Platte für 2 war lecker, aber sehr viel. Eigentlich waren wir nach der Vorspeise satt. Für den Hauptgang haben wir uns für ein Lamm Curry sowie für ein Thali mit Hühnchen entschieden. Alles sehr lecker. Einziger Kritikpunkt: das Lamm hätte zarter sein können. Ich klage da aber auf höchstem Niveau! Der Service ist super nett und schnell. Wir konnten leider nicht alles verputzen und liessen die Reste einpacken. Für uns ist das Tamarind Hill Top 3 aller indischen Restaurants in Zürich. Wir kommen gerne wieder!

Wir haben den Geburtstag unserer Kollegin im Tamarind Hill gefeiert. Das Restaurant ist sehr schön eingerichtet, der Service war top, sowie auch der kleine Überraschungsdessert für unsere Kollegin mit dem "Happy B-Day" Song, welcher vom Personal im Hintergrund abgespielt wurde!Das Essen war köstlich und zufriedenstellend, jedoch ist es meiner Meinung ein bisschen zu teuer! Aber alles in Allem ein gelungener Abend!!!
i was in zurich for holidays and i came across this beautiful restaurant excellent food and amazing friendly service i wish we had something like this in hungary
Bestes Restaurant in Zürich! Super Service super Essen super atmosphere. Kann man nur weiterempfehlen.
Das Essen ist hervorragend und gehört sicher zum besten in der Umgebung. Leider sind die Preise (wie man es in indischen Restaurants kennt) an der oberen Grenze.
just fantastic! great food. The best in Zurich if not in Switzerland. Very nice athmosphere and parking right in front of the restaurant.

Have been here 4 times now. Loved the food. Thali portions are huge.You can ask them to make the food spicy as per your liking.Akshay and all the staff members have always made sure that we have a pleasant experience. Most of the times they offer "on the house" beer to the guys and fresh homemade peppermint juice/mango lassi to the ladies. Once we had an "on the house" dessert as well which was yummy to its last bite.They have nice decorations and live music sometimes.Overall, enjoyed the food and ambiance here.

Super tasty. Meat dishes are above 35CHF to 44chf.I loved the taste but i think it could be cheaper for the portion given. Also the decoration was a bit too overwhelming. When we visited there in November, EVERYTHING was in red and wears a Santa hat.

Very good food and friendly service. Bit pricey but portions were big.Only thing that I found disappointing was the gulab jamu which left a bad taste in an otherwise perfect Thali (and felt like they were the canned variety). However, I guess, I should not expect fresh gulab jamuns in Europe.
The main dish was very delicious, I had tikka masala with lamb. However I can not recommend the mixed starter, if you are not a big fan of fried food.
kann ich sehr Empfehlen top von Küche und Service und sehr gute Atmosphärekann ich sehr empfehlenProfesionelle für des Chef gratuliere

Friendly atmosphere, nice ambiance, nice staff. Food was not fresh, overcooked, too many onions, mushrooms and peas from the can (at least texture and fell were like). Sadly, there were no distinctive spices, as you would expect in an indian restaurant, i.e. everything tasted very much alike. But, several good aspects, too: no colouring, no flavour enhancer (like MSG) and credits to the staff. But, regarding food, we found the relation between price and quality far from satisfying.

Went there a few days ago with a friend. We went for the al la carte menu and started with the shared mixture starter. We should not have done that because we are fans of fried stuff which is generally what you get for Indian starters. It was ok though traditional fried startersHowever, the main was good and perfectly spiced. We did not pick anything that was stated as (very) spicy.
