Hence, I guess those dishes are very spicy as our was main courses was already up thereThe price is slightly above what you would expect. Though, it is worth it for the good genuin Indian food
Tasty foods, great service and nice atmosphere. There is a live acoustic music when I was there. The decoration in restaurant is very charming.

we set out from our hotel in glattbrugg on a tram and got down at schaffhauserstasse in search of a hotel krishna which we had read reviews on trip advisor . we searched around for half hour and couldnt find it .its then that we realised that the krishna restaurant was closed and a new restaurant had come up at that place " Tamarind INn" . we ordered indian thali dinner . and the food was awesome ,authentic indian taste which is difficult to find even in india. i was full praise for the chef and i conveyed it to the owner who is a friendly guy , who said the chef had joined recently.the ambience is peaceful with dim lights and clean surroundingsa bit expensive though , all restaurants in zurich are a bit expensive

Die Begrüssung war sehr freundlich. Unsere Dame, für den Apéro zuständig, versteht nur englisch doch sie ist sehr hilfsbereit.Das Essen wurde von allen Teilnehmer/Innen des Weihnachtsessens sehr gelobt. Mein buttered chicken war sehr zart und sehr geschmackvoll.Das vorzügliche Essen hat unserer Stimmung nochmals einen positiven Schub versetzt. Preis / Leistung ist in Ordnung.Wir kommen wieder.
Thali was ok, nothing special. The lamb curry could have been better. Still long way to go compared to London indian joints like ChutneyMarys.

Besuch: Samstagabend, Dezember 2016Status: vorreserviertSitzplatz: 8er Tisch direkt unter Klimaanlage, die nicht abgeschaltet werden konnte und deren kalte Luft, durch Vorhänge nur ungenügend abgemildert werden konnte.Bestellung: Kellnerin sprach nur englisch, ein Teilen der Hauptgerichte ist nicht möglich (für uns ein merkwürdiger Umstand, da in der indischen Küche das gemeinsame Essen von verschiedenen Platten Kultur hat?)Wartezeiten: teils sehr lange. 10 Minuten vom Bestellen bis zum Apero, 30 Minuten vom 2. Bestellen bis zur Vorspeise, 30 Minuten vom 3. Bestellen bis zum Hauptgang, 30 Minuten vom 4. Bestellen bis zum DessertEssen: Qualitativ hochstehend!Essenshinweis: alle Gerichte ohne "mild" in der Beschreibung sind scharf - sehr scharf für durchschnittliche Schweizer Geschmacksknospen, Portionen gross - sehr gross (je nach Körpergrösse und Appetit)Service: häufiges Nachfragen am Tisch, gratis Geburtstagsdessert für's GeburtstagskindPreisniveau: je nach Portemonnaie mitteleres - hohes Preissegment; Vorspeise: ab 8.50 Fr. - 16 Fr., Hauptgang Vegi ab 28 Fr., Fleisch/Fisch ab 32 Fr., Dessert ab 9 Fr.Ambiente: Musik und Licht um 19 Uhr dezent gedimmt, Livemusik laut - sehr laut (Gespräch nur mit direkten Sitznachbarn/Gegenüber möglich), im Verlaufe des Abends wurde auch die Hintergrundmusik in den Spielpausen lauter,stark gefülltes Lokal sorgt ebenfalls für Erhöhung der allgemeinen LautstärkeFazit: Wer lange Pausen zwischen den Gängen schätzt und sich vor lautem Abiente nicht scheut ist hier gut aufgehoben.

lovely food, lovely staff, nicely decorated. it is worth to go there because it's not a typical indian restaurant. it has its own flair and atmosphere. On saturday you have as sometimes as well live music entertainment which is great.
Excellent restaurant in Zurich the food was excellent the people were friendly the restaurant was beautiful and I would recommend it we went to the VIP lounge and was excellent I love it

I have been here and must say that if you want to experience true Indian flavors then Tamarind Hill is the place to go to. Loved not only by Indians in Zurich but many of my swiss friends also relished the excellent food here.Apart from food, the staff headed by Akash is excellent and extremely helpful and on top of it true to their profession.I always get surprised on my every visit... And don't miss the Mumbai masala soda and chocolate fondue.Not to forget, the ambience, is amazing. Warm and cozy :)A big thumbs up to the whole team. Keep up the excellent quality. Cheers!!
Awesome food and great service The restaurant was beautifully decorated and enjoyed the live music The girl who was serving us was so professional yet so friendly Will be back soon

wir waren über mittag essen. es hatte 3 birjanis zur auswahl und drei wochengerichte. ich bestellte ein chicken birjani. es war sehr schön angerichtet, schmeckte aber sehr bescheiden - und war erst noch relativ teuer. bis jetzt das enttäuschendste indische restaurant (von 4), das wir in zürich besucht haben. die bedienung war zwar äusserst zuvorkommend und freundlich, aber dies allein genügt natürlich nicht. kommen nicht wieder.

Was recommended by few friends and got a chance to visit this restaurant while we were in ZurichThe veg thali and the chicken Thali were awesome and also loved the Mumbai lime sodaThe host was exceptionally polite and warmHaven't experienced this amazing hospitality in a long time
Celebrated our anniversary there last night Very friendly service and very delicious food They made our night so special Highly recommended!!! Try the tandoori pineapple... was amazing
I was there with my Friends and After Living here in zurich for 8 years finally found a nice indian Restaurant Lamb roganjosh and Butter chicken was amazing . Will Be back soon

Trip to heaven in earth is complete when taste buds are also treated equally well. Tamarind Hill is best Indian restaurant I ever visited in Europe during my trips to London Zurich Amsterdam Paris Berlin.North Indian thali is lovely. Staff are very friendly and will help you get rid off your day's tension with tasty food and homely service and You will not miss India when you are here. Cool ambience very apt to the occasion like christmas. Meet charming Saira who will make your visit memorable with friendly talks and lots of information about Zurich.

Had dinner last night... the food was at best forgettable. Never again. Sweet chicken Chettinad, boiled mutton dropped in some lame gravy that claimed to be Roganjosh! Service not inefficient but far from friendly.
It was the best Indian i had and even me 10 year enjoyed the experience It was so beautifully decorated and staff are so nice

We went to this restaurant for dinner and liked so much. We ourselves own an Indian restaurant and know how the good Indian foods are. In overal Swiss is more expensive compared to other EU countries so no complaints about the price. However, quantity can be a bit more.Recommended Dal soup!
Great dinner with friends, the food was great and so was the service. We asked for a recommendation on the choice of dishes and we were not disappointed!

We were a group of 6 and had a fantastic night .We were seated in their vip section and it was the best in the indian i had in last 3 years and the service was excellentCant wait to go back !!!!!Lovely staff by the way

Der Empfang ist sehr herzlich, das Ambiente etwas verstaubt, aber irgendwie passt das Ganze zum Konzept und zur Gastfreundschaft.Die Speiseauswahl mittags besteht aus 3 Menüs und 3 Wochenempfehlungen. Das bestellte Murgh Makhani (Butter chicken) war geschmacklich tadellos, die Hähnchenbrust leider etwas trocken, die hausgemachte Frühlingsrolle knusprig, leider aber sehr fettig. Das Naan war sehr gut und konnte nachbestellt werden. Preis-Leistung ist in Ordnung.Wiederholungsfaktor intakt!
Best Indian food I ever had! Best food! Great X-mas decoration! Nice Restaurant! Great staff!!! Thanks so much!!!
The food is really awesome.. butter chicken, malai kofta and chocolate fondue is the best!! The best Indian restaurant in Zurich!!

I visit India very frequently and same aroma and flavored indian food are very rare to get in zürich but i went last month to Tamarind and i was like wow.. i ate chicken curry with roti i felt like i was in india pure Indian food.. i had a best Indien food in zürich i think whole of switzerland .. must go restaurent.
Went on a tuesday night expecting a quiet indian meal but in the end turned out to be a fun night Beautiful decor , top notch service and the food was to die for Cant wait to be back again

What an awesome experience once againWent in on a Saturdaynight without reservation but we were accomadated inspight of waiting for 45 minutes we didnt mind as we had few drinks at the barThe girl serving me was super friendly and recommended us few dishesIt was the best paneer butter masala and dal makhani we hadCant wait to go back

I was there with my partner for the second time...it was an awesome experienceThe service was courteous and politeWe odered the butterchicken and nilgiri fish curry with some garlic and corriander naanIt was AWESOMECant wait to go backAnd complimwnrs on the decor , it was so beautifully decorated for christmas!!!

I did visit the restaurant based on review but unfortunately the food was the poorest quality. Meat itself was so dry and stringy. I did mention forehand for a spicy meal and I was terribly let down as it tasted so sweet that I had to consume just raw chillies.Everyone's feedback does matter so please leave honest feedback.

A group of 7 went for a birthday dinner. The food was very nice, one of the only places I've been in Switzerland that was actually spicy and tasted authentic. Compliments to the chef!The service was prompt and friendly, no one was ever wanting for a drink. The space was nicely decorated. Overall a great night. I'd return when in the area

Me and my girlfriend went to this restaurant with high hopes as it was ranked 4th in Zurich. On arrival we were not greeted, waited for 10 minutes and then was told to sit at the bar whilst our table was being made ready. The waitress came over promptly to ask for drinks but in a aggressive/unexpected manner. She then TRIED to pour my pint and gave me half froth and half beer. When questioned about this she replied "yes" clearly she doesn't no anything. Starters were slightly salty and overpriced for portion size. The poppadoms were stale and dripping with oil. RANK! We had not finished eating our starters - I HAD FOOD IN MY MOUTH- she took out plates which had food on them and asked that we order mains.We ordered 1 main (paneer vegetarian ) it cost 29CHF. That is about £27 for a main that was cheese. It was overly spicy for something that is supposed to be mild.There was no goodbye when we payed and this is a horrible restaurant.I would recommend any other restaurant but not this one. Please avoid save your money and starve that night but don't go here.
I was with my family there to celebrate my parents anniversary Awesome food, excellent service and beautifully decorated for Christmas Highly recommended! !!

We chose the Tamarind Hill especially for a birthday celebration. It was one of the most beautiful nights in Zürich. The food was delicious, the atmosphere was perfect, the live band was amazing and the service couldn't have been better. What I also enjoyed was the pretty presentation of the dishes. We felt very welcome and I am sure we will return here again.

Nice place for dinner, food quality excellent, service top notch! We were warmly greeted, the staff was very attentive towards customers. Prices are slighter on the upper side compared to other Indian restaurants.

I have had wonderful take aways and also eaten in at this excellent indian restaurant. The food is extremely tasty and consistently good quality. Jimmy, the owner, is nearly always there which I think is a really good aspect of the service. I'll be a loyal customer for a long time....!
Sehr guten essen Vielseitig Sehr freundliche bedienung Gute preis leistung Gute lage Parkplatz vor dem haus Livemusic
Welcoming atmosphere and very delicious food, loved the setting of the resteurant. Simply amazing. Customer service on a higher level.
Nourriture excellente, décoration soignée, personnel sympa... un super endroit à découvrir à Zurich!
Was out to celebrate our aniversarry . Awesome some service and amazing ambience It was the best indian i had in europe !!! Highly recommendable !!!
This is truly as awesome as it can get in Zurich. It's my default destination whenever I crave Indian.
Wenn man gerne indisch Essen hat, dann ist man im Tamarind Hill richtig. Die Preise sind jedoch eher hoch.

Eigentlich mag ich Buffets überhaupt nicht. Aber hier im Tamarind Hill war ich einfach nur begeistert. So konnte ich diverse, allesamt sehr schmackhafte Gerichte probieren.Ebenfalls hervorzuheben sind die hausgemachten Getränke wie Tee und Icetea. Auch das Glas Wasser kommt mit leckeren Beeren und Orange garniert. Wundervoll zu sehen dass es noch Restaurants gibt die sich solche Mühe geben.Auch die Einrichtung ist ansprechend - obwohl schon die Weihnachtsdeko hängt :-)Von unserer Bedienung waren wir auch ganz angetan. Sie spricht English und ist wirklich zuvorkommend, höflich und einfach nur zum Knuddeln.Wenn Indisch dann ganz sicher hier!
Then you have found the perfect spot. Great food, wonderful hospitality and definitly best thali in town! Love it!!!!

As an Indian food lover, I strongly recommend this place. The staff is very kind and helpful, the food is just delicious (love the coconut naan called patschwari BTW ), the owner is very customer oriented and makes sure your visit is an unforgettable one by all kind of different gestures. The restaurant's setting gives this place a nice atmosphere also. In warm and sunny days, they have tables outside located at a front terrace you can enjoy. The only downside is perhaps that the place has become so popular that you better make sure to book a table prior to your visit but the owner will always do his utmost to accommodate you. A place you must visit while in Zurich. Bon appétit !
very friendly personal. very good ambiente and location and very delicious menues and drinks. thanks a lot!

Last evening I spent an amazing evening with my friends in Tamarind Hill. I am vegetarian and I let the manager recommend a dish for me. It was excellent, spicy and tasty, exactly how I like it!The waitresses were very nice to us and they were also beautifully dressed! Being in the restaurant for 1.5 hours made me feel I am in another exotic world! I can fully recommend it to everyone!
went a night before diwali - was enthralled by the atmosphere! ordered for a thali ( delicious !!!) they always have a surprise element which leaves you blissful and happy! highly recommend !!

I have been to Tamarind Hill on a few occasions, and every experience was amazing. The politeness of the staff, the amazing atmosphere, and not forgetting the incredible dishes complimenting the whole scene. Its really a great place with ambiance that allows one to just enjoy and relax.

Wir fanden das Essen in Tamarind Hill einfach himmlisch. Das Ambiente ist sehr schön und die Bedienung sehr freundlich. Wir haben das Restaurant bereits weiterempfohlen. Wir hatten Glück, dass wir noch Live-Musik dazu hatten. Anscheinend gibt es regelmässig Livemusik in diesem Restaurant. Was will man mehr. Wir kommen gerne wieder.

Tamarind Hill ist meiner Meinung nach das Beste Restaurant in Zürich. Man spürt, dass es mit viel Liebe und sehr viel Wert auf Details gelegt wird. Der Service ist ausgezeichnet und überaus freundliches Personal trifft man hier an. Wir kommen gerne immer wieder hier Essen. Es lohnt sich wirklich auszuprobieren.

Wir waren gestern spontan in Oerlikon unterwegs und haben das Tamarind ausprobiert. Alles war TOP. Nette und schnelle Bedienung, gutes Ambiente mit guter, dezenter Hintergrundmusik aber vor allem das Essen war genial. Die Vorspeisen sehr schön angerichtet und auch schmackhaft, das ChickenTandoori und Lamm Tikka Massalla ausgezeichnet auch von der genügend grossen Portion her. Ich meine der beste Inder in Town und Umgebung. Wir werden wieder kommen, sehr schnell. Vielen Dank.
Buffet lunch with decent food and nice decor. Would definitely go back. good indian food but not very spicy

Es ist nicht leicht, in der Schweiz ein indisches Restaurant zu finden, welches gleichzeitig erstklassiges Essen und schöne Atmosphäre bietet. Im Tamarind Hill habe ich beides gefunden. Das Tandoori Chicken war himmlisch, ebenso die King Prawns zur Vorspeise. Komme gerne wieder. Service sehr freundlich, allerdings etwas gar langsam....

Das hohe Ranking dieses Restaurants kann ich mir nur damit erklären, dass hier eine Horde von Mitarbeitenden aus Bangalore bei den Bewertungen stark nachgeholfen hat. Für sechs Mikro-Stückchen Lamm und dann noch ein paar Schälchen mit weissem Reis, braunen Linsen und Kichererbsen rund CHF 40.- zu verlangen, ist selbst für Zürich "far out". Dessert: Billige Massenware, Rahm aus der Spraydose, lieblos hingeklatscht. Die auf der Speisekarte aufgeführten "frischen Früchte" waren nicht vorhanden. Never again – da gibt es weit bessere indische Restaurants in Zürich. Gut ist einzig der Parkplatz vor dem Haus.

We had the lunch buffet. There was a chicken and fish curry and vegetables, thin nanns, papadum and salad.Food was okay. But we were not wowed by the cooking.Perhaps we will try a meal from the ala carte menu in the future.The restaurant is beautifully decorated and the 2 lady staff are very nice.
Best Inida food we've found in over 8 years in Zurich. Top Quality food, great service and superb atmosphere, cannot recommend it enought

This is the best Indian food that we had in restaurant in a long time.Service - excellentStaff - excellentFood - excellentIt also has nice cute outdoor sitting arrangements, it was beautiful with little lights when we visited one of the evening this fall.Few pointers though :1. On asking for spicy curry / veggie, we were recommended vindaloo however it wasn't even near to spicy to what you will expect from vindaloo. It was a good eat but definitely could have been called something else!2. Don't be fooled by name "chocolate fondue", it's actually chocolate lava cake with 3-4 pieces of strawberries !Must try Recommendation:1. Mango mint soup !!! - To die for !2. Grilled pineapple dessert
Friendly service, excellent and authentic food, nice atmosphere, definitely worth a visit. We will come back
Nette Bedienung und leckere Drinks und Essen. Preis eher gehobene klasse. Wir kommen gerne wieder. Danke
لقد حصلنا على هذا المطعم الهندي واستمتعنا بالاكل فيه ، الخدمة متميزة، قائمة الطعام وفيرة، اعجبتنا اكلة الدجاج مكاني بالتوابل الحارة وكانت رائعة.

I went there for Dinner with 2 Friends who are vegetarians. It was my first time and I was lucky to get a table on short notice. The staff is very friendly and you are always greeted with a smile.The food is very authentic and incredible tasty. We tried many different things so to much to list here. I'd go as far as to say you can try anything and won't be disappointed.The Atmosphere is fantastic, the seating has enough space and is very comfortable. Also there are a few parking spots directly in the front plus the Tram 10/14 stop just 10m from it.Oh, and the price is also fantastic, for Zurich even a little cheap.Will be back soon.

Thanks to Tamarind Hill team to making our evening Nice.Each category selection is decided keeping price in mind. (Seeing Trip Advisor rating probably, We went with very high expectations). Below is my review for Tamarind Hill.Taste : AverageFood Presentation : Above Average.Ambiance : Below Average.Acoustic : Very BadStaff : Very Welcoming.Accessibility : Easy to reach. (tram 10 and 14 stops right in front)Price : 55 CHF approx. (Per person)Sitting arrangement : Congested.

Très bonne qualité de nourriture, service agréable, nous avons été très bien reçus et choyés. Une très bonne adresse avec un bon rapport qualité prix. Des places de parking devant le restaurant. Je recommande vivement.

Selten so einen tollen, freundlichen, aufmerksamen Service erlebt. Die Bedienung konnte äusserst kompetent Antwort auf unsere Frage zu den Gerichten geben. Das Restaurant ist sehr gemütlich und das Essen schmeckte fantastisch. Wir waren zu 4 dort und jeder bestellte nebst dem Hauptgang eine Vorspreise. Wirklich alles war köstlich. Ich habe meine Portion nicht geschafft, dann bat man mir an, das Essen einzupacken, was ich sehr aufmerksam fand und dankend annahm. Ganz toll war auch die Verabschiedung des Chefs der uns am Ende noch auf verschiedene stattfindene Events im Restaurant aufklärte. Vielen Dank für den tollen Abend und macht weiter so!

Awesome food - almost authentic and very tasty. The staffs are very welcoming and attentive to your comfort. I visited this restaurant last week with a friend of mine for dinner. I had high expectations (after reading the reviews in TripAdvisor) and I was not at all disappointed. The food was mouth watering and the serving portions are more than sufficient. I would definitely recommend this place for a dinner and would try to be there on my next visit to Zurich!
Awesome!! Food, presentation and taste is amazing.. Bday celebration was too good. Staff was too kind, humble and friendly. Overall Excellent!!
Ausgezeichnetes Mittagsbuffet, auch noch um 13 Uhr! Sehr schönes Ambiente, freundliches Personal! Auch einfach mit ÖV zu erreichen!
Comida , boa uns dos melhores pratos indiano que se pode comer em Zurich , vale apena voltar! Um servicio muito atencioso.

Aufmerksam gemacht durch die prima Rezensionen in diesem Forum gingen wir hin. Ohne Reservation ist's schwierig hier. Das Lokal um 19 Uhr bereits gut gefüllt. Der Service äusserst nett ... nicht alle sind der deutschen Sprache mächtig - aber englisch kann man ja heutzutag von den Besuchern erwarten. Das ist durchaus ok. Zum Apéro Drinks bestellt (wir wurden von 3 verschiedenen Personen nach unseren Getränkewünschen befragt, weder Person 2 noch 3 wussten, dass wir bereits bestellt hatten), die kamen dann auch innert halbwegs nützlicher Frist und hübsch angerichtet. Dann einen gemischten Vorspeisenteller bestellt .... nach ca. 45 Minuten kam auch dieser - und alle Speisen waren köstlich. Danach nochmals 50 Minuten warten auf die Hauptspeisen - auch diese waren wunderbar zubereitet, grosses Lob an die Küche. An den Nachbartischen wurden Reklamationen laut betr. langer Wartezeiten - für mich war das jetzt kein sooo grosses Problem. Problematisch war dann halt schon, dass ein Teil der Bestellungen vergessen ging ... eines (von 2 bestellten) Naanbroten - nach Reklamation und lange nach dem Servieren der Hauptspeisen noch zu bringen, wenn Letztere schon beinahe verspiesen waren ist halt schon auch ein wenig spät ... auf die Nachlieferung des zweiten vergessenen Brotes verzichteten wir natürlich. Auch für eine Bestellung von weiterem Wasser mussten wir zweimal nachhaken, bis dann endlich mal das Gewünschte gebracht wurde. Irgendwie schade - die Küchenleistung ist wirklich ausgezeichnet - aber wenn das Gesamtpaket nicht stimmt muss man den Abend als durchaus nett aber nicht überragend einstufen. Dass zuletzt auf der Rechnung ein Drink zuviel verrechnet wurde war sicher nicht böse Absicht der Betreiber sondern ein weiteres Zeichen dafür, dass hier die organisatorischen Abläufe dringend überprüft werden müssten wenn man sich längere Zeit auf dieser exzellenten Position in diesem Forum sehen möchte - was ich diesem Restaurant aufgrund seiner fantastischen Küchenleistung auch wünschen möchte.

Speisen Herrvorrhagend, und auch sehr schmackhaft und schön Presentiert, sowie auch die Desserts. Ambience sehr sehr Gepflegt, sehr schön heimlich. Service Personal sehr freundlich und aufmerksahm. Sehr Preis-wert. Wir waren sehr, sehr zufrieden, und habe bereits an andere Freunde empfohlen.
Pures Indisches Ambiente so wie es sich gehört.Essen und Service Top!!!War schon lange auf der Suche nach ein sensationelles Indisches Restaurant.Endlich gefunden :-)
Great Food, The best Indian Restaurant I've never visited in Switzerland. Personal is very friendly and service is top. Next time I'll go to Zurich, I'm going again to have good time and good food.

Für mich das Beste Restaurant ever!Essen - Ausgezeichnet!Service - Super!Ambiente - Romantisch gemütlich!Wir waren zu dritt im Tamarind Hill und uns wurde jeder Wunsch von den Lippen abgelesen, von A-Z ein perfekter Abend!Das Personal ist sehr zuvorkommend und das Essen einfach traumhaft und wunderschön angerichtet. Man kommt ins Restaurant und fühlt sich auf Anhieb pudelwohl, die Atmosphäre stimmt einfach, es ist gemütlich und trotzdem auch sehr edel eingerichtet.Wir waren total begeistert und waren bestimmt nicht zum letzten Mal dort!Das Restaurant ist auf jeden Fall absolut empfehlenswert!!Und ein persönliches Dankeschön an den Chef, der keinen Wunsch offen lässt und persönlich auf seine Gäste eingeht.
Very difficult to find a good Indian restaurant. But Tamarind Hill is the best in Zurich. Very good food and excellent variety very close to authentic Indian. Really enjoyed the meal.
Really nice food, especially the mango lassi was exellent. good service, prices are ok (upper end). we are going again.

We have visited Tamarind hill quite a few times since the first visit in June. The tamarind hill team recognise us as a family and accommodate the family needs very well. Hubby likes spicy, he gets spicy, daughter likes papadums and gets them on demand.The team as a whole are very friendly, professional and always polite, it makes a world of difference to eat somewhere you feel genuinely welcome.The food is immense, I have not had dish yet that is just "okay" plus the manager's customer service has far exceeded what we would expect, leaving us feel like valued customers.We will definitely be back and this will continue to be a regular place to have a curry in Zurich, for me and my family.Thank you for opening such a lovely Indian restaurant in Zurich!

Das Essen war geschmacklich ok, mehr nicht.Das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis hat leider nicht gepasst. Eine Vorspeise ("Somosa") mit nur zwei kleinen "Stückchen" für 7,- SFR ist zu teuer. Der Reis war etwas zu trocken und das "Chicken Tandoori" war sehr fade.Satt sind wir leider auch nicht geworden.Der ansonsten sehr freundliche Service hat leider die Qualität der Speisen auch nicht verbessert.

We went there on a weekday evening after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. We were very pleasantly surprised by absolutely excellent service and delicious food. Indian restaurants in Zurich tend to offer very spicy dishes and normally have very few dishes from the northern regions of India which are milder but not less aromatic and flavoursome. This restaurant as an exception and has a very good range of spicy and milder dishes. The food presentation is superb, very European. The staff is very friendly and attentive, they speak excellent English. Firstly we were offered very nice tasty bite-size papadams with their excellent home-made mint sauce. I had some chef's special starter of prawns with various very delicious sauces. My husband opted for potato and onion friters. I chose a traditional tandoori chicken (was pleasantly surprised to be able to choose legs or breasts as usually I have to specially ask for legs which I prefer), it was nicely cooked and did not have much artificial colouring. The garlic bread was tasty but slightly on the small size. My husband had some Rogan Josh lamb ehich was excellent. We were offered a complementary desert (panna cotta and ice-cream) which was delicious. I would highly recommend booking in advance as this place is very popular, especially towards the end of the week. They also offer very good lunch buffet. A big advantage is the parking right in front of the restaurant but the restsurant located right next to the tram stop (trams 10) so it is easy enough to get to by public transport.
Decent Indian buffet for lunch or dinner, if the weather is nice, also outdoor seating is available. Next time I want to try the ala carte as well, thalis looked very good.
with some friend we had really nice evening there!the food, the service and the owner was just great!I highly recommend it!!

This restaurant is a drastic change from its predecessor! Priced slightly on the higher side, however the ambience is good with very attentive staff.. food is very tasty nd authentic...I just wish I had a little more served on the plate..found the portions slightly small

I have been going to Tamarind Hill, Zurich with my colleagues whenever we are in Zurich on Official work. The food is always authenticate and very tasty. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a good Indian cuisine in Zurich (we have tried many places and none of them could impress except Tamarind Hill)

Fantastic! Food was delicious, real tastes I had in India; spice blends are done by the owner who is passionate about bringing good Indian food to the table. Fabulous service and great advice on what to mix with what. I actually leave for Prague tomorrow and have to say, am a little sad to have found such a gem on my doorstep just on the eve of my moving!
Spent auntie's 59th birthday last evening here. Everything was perfect. Food is made with love, you can taste it. Owner and staff were very nice and accommodating. We will be back. Thank you Jimmy

I can't praise this relatively new restaurant enough and as a result, have returned on numerous occasions. I'd basically given up on finding good Indian food in Zurich but Tamarind Hill has surpassed my expectations with fantastic Indian cuisine, a very welcoming staff and a stylish interior. It's no surprise that word is spreading fast to the point that you will need to reserve a table in the evenings to be on the safe side. The diverse and exquisite lunch buffet is excellent value and an ideal way to try some new dishes. If you're craving good Indian food, you know where to go; it won't be your last visit - you have been warned ;-)!
If you're a fan of Indian food, this is the place for you in Zurich. Amazingly delicious Indian cuisine with great service by the friendly owner and his staff.

I was there with a big group of 20 people and the buffet was amazing. They also serve Indian beer. It's so tasty that I can't put it in words. The service was very nice and attentive. I will go back and can recommend it.

If words could describe a place like this, then I would be a poet.As someone rightly said what can stick to your palette is bound to stay in your mind and I can assure you that my mouth is still watering as i type these words.Probably the best Indian food that I have tasted in Zurich. The service was excellent and so was the hospitality. I would recommend everyone to try this restaurant. Reserving it before visiting would be a better idea as evenings are almost always full.
Delicious food with amazing presentation.. I would recommend everyone to try atleast once and then they can never stop visiting this place... Its just Amazing .. Awesome
Surprised to see quite a lot of veggie options. The food was delicious and the portions were good too. The service was quick and the manager was amiable. Overall, a very fine dining experience.

I liked the tasty food and the polite service, it seems that a reservation on Saturday evening would be advised, the restaurant was occupied by families, group of friends and couples and I was lucky to get a free table - some people had to wait but they were taken care of.

Definitely a place to go if you appreciate authentic Indian food. We went for dinner with some friends and all of us were delighted; excellent hospitality and attention. We will go back for sure. Must visit!

I was there with my friends and we all were so amazed and impressed by this New fantastic Restaurant. I Would highly recommend to book in advance as we had to wait 30 mins to get a table on a tuesday night at 19.00 Uhr

Eigentlich isst man Indisch in Indien oder dann in London. Nun auch in Zürich. Was das Tamarind Hill Restaurant bietet ist sensationell. Erst seit 4 Monaten geöffnet und das Essen ist hervorragend und indisch identisch. Der Chef ist Inder und in der Küche sind sie sicher auch Inder. So frisch und authentisch können nur Einheimische Kochen.Als Vorspeise waren es Riesengarnelen (und sie waren riesig) und gebratener Fisch. Beide Gerichte fantastisch gewürzt und mit einem Green apple Chutey serviert,Als Hauptgang gabs dann den Klassiker Butter Chicken Tandoori mit Naan Brot und Reis und mein Partner hatte Fisch und Crevetten Curry, Wow es war himmlisch!Und achten sie bei Ihrem Besuch auf den englischen Akzent des Chefs, so schönt spricht nur die englische Königin.....
Heaven on earth . Had never imagined that we could experience such good Indian food and great hospitality at Tamarind hill .

A friend who had been here had recommended it to me, and we just ate there today. The food was very fresh and tasty; I ordered the spicy shrimp thali and loved all of it. The portion was so generous that, when I return -soon-with my husband, we will share it and be satisfied. My friend was very happy with her selections from the buffet, too. The decor is very calming and pleasant, and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Having lived in Europe for 18 years it is finally nice to find a fist rate indian restaurant. The service is very friendly and quick. The extensive menu is cooked to order with fresh ingredients and of a very high standard. I will definitely reccomend this restaurant to people who enjoy authentic indian food.

After hearing so many good reviews from friends i finally decided to give it a visit....it was a monday evening at 7 and it was so busy, we were told tgat there is waiting of 45 mins....lovely setting, very friendly staff and food definately worth waiting for....loved tge lamb roganjosh and garlic naan.... not to forget tge awesome drink selection they have.it was my first time enjoying a indian restaurant ....highly recommend and will be going back soon
We had the lunch buffet at this restaurant. we were thoroughly disappointed the food was tasteless. the rice was dry

I agree with all the positive reviews. This was an amazing find in Oerlikon, Zurich and the food was excellent. The manager and staff were very friendly. A short 8 minute walk from the Oerlikon train station.
They have the best food, very friendly service and excellent environment. Definitely a lovely place to go and I will be back! :) Thank you so much Tamarind Hill!

After enjoying my first time at the Tamarind so much, we went back to see if it was just a flash in the pan, or if it delivers consistently.Well I have been twice in a week, it is that nice.Every dish I have tried from Biryani to Lamb Chettinad has been exquisite.The food is presented in a modern way and show's care and attention. No just slopping the food on a plate here.The owner is a wonderful host, and manages any special request you ask of him. I also like my food quite spicy and he manages to get it spot on each time.Can't wait to go back and try another dish.

Visited this restaurant with family for my daughters third birthday, luckily we dined early. The restaurant understandably was very busy, which is no surprise as the food is delicious.We had a selection of veg and non veg starters, curries, rice, bread selection and desserts.I have to say, this was by far the nicest Indian food I have eaten out in Zurich.The service was great and the manager was attentive and always smiled, a nice attribute to have and show the customers.Definitely recommend this place if you want good, tasty, Indian food.The amount of Indians visiting this place is also a good indicator that this restaurant is a good one, visit and you will not be disappointed.Book before you go as it is a busy gem of a place!

Dined here with three generations of the family and a friend and we all enjoyed the experience very much. The menu offers a different choice to the usual and the decor creatively enhances the whole experience. This place is well worth a visit if you are in town.The flavourings were distinctive and the spice blends demonstrated a chef who understands how to bring different spice combinations together to create something that is very good. As with the majority of 'Indian' restaurants outside the UK, the heat of the spices was muted - perhaps next time we'll ask them to take them off the leash!The presentation of the food was excellent showing much thought and care. The different dishes were quite distinctive and the naan bread in particular was excellent. Desserts were also noteworthy.Definitely worth another visit next time I'm in Zurich - which will be soon!
Sehr gutes Essen, schöne Auswahl und freundlicher Service.Seit meiner Indienreise vor bald 30 Jahren kein so leckeres Thali mehr gegessen...
The food was ok not really amazing. The order was also messed didn't get the same things that we ordered but had to ask them to change. Later they offered compliments...
Very nice Indian food! Prices were ok and menu was selective. But the taste was yummy! Loved it. Take a tram no. 14 or 10 get down at salestig! Restaurant in right there to your right side!!

Dropped by looking for original Indian flavors and was extremely happy with the food. Lamb rogan josh and garlic naan were delicious. If you're craving authentic Indian food in Zurich, this is the place!

Found this restaurant on TripAdvisor and it was great. Little restaurant. Not too fancy. Food was delicious. The last time I had Indian food that good was 10 years ago in Cape Town. My wife has Celiac's and has to eat Gluten Free. No problem. About 80% of the Buffett was GF and they set up to avoid cross contamination.

This restaurant is the BESTEST!! All the foods, Especially the Thalis and Biryanis.It is so tasty and very delicious..i would totally recommend this Restaurant to everyone and to people who loves Indian foods like me now.. Vegetarians,Vegans or people who loves Curries come and eat in this place.!!
I went there with my husband,they have excellent food tasty and spicy,,great customer service...will definitely be going bk there for dinner the next week..good job guys...

Bin ein Riesen Fan von Indisches Essen. Bei Tamarind Hill hatte ich ein super Erlebnis. Das Essen war von A-Z absolut fantastisch!! Nur noch hier ! Wow! Meine besten Empfehlungen! Für mich das beste indische Restaurant in der Schweiz!
Best Butter Chicken which I ever ate! I paid 35 CHF for this dish so not so bad like for Zurich. I fully recommend this restaurant. :)

Finally real Indian food in Zurich, there are Indian restaurant is Zurich but most are European Indian food. The presentation is beautiful something for the eye as well as the stomach. I love the butter chicken and the king prawn zaffrani. The service is very good, friendly and opened. Very relaxing atmosphere. If you ask for something a little different they will try their best to give it to you.

Finally an Indian restaurant in Zurich where you get authentic Indian food, a touch of innovation, excellent presentation and value for money. Positively surprised by the different atmosphere here, a certain freshness that contrasts with the stereotypical decoration and presentation of most other Indian restaurants. Was a pleasure to meet the creative and inspiring owner, Akshay, who delighted us with his adventures, insights and great hospitality. Highly recommended!

Had the Non-Vegetarian Thali and it really hit the spot. The hospitality at the restaurant is par excellence. Just reminds me of a genuine north Indian restaurant from home. Highly recommended by a foodie Indian for Indian food lovers.
Had a nice evening on the terrace. Great menu, also in English and food is superb. Friendly and relaxed service. Strongly recommended!

I found one of the best restaurant in Zurich with authentic Indian Cuisine. Service of this restaurant is great. I am so happy & I eat in this restaurant 3weeks. He has amazing food. Here I find real Indian food out side India.
Absolutely excellent food, spicy and tasty, everything was perfect, atmosphere also excellent, don't miss
Das Ambiente, Auswahl der Speisekarte lassen keine Wünsche offen.Das Essen war sehr frisch und sehr lecker. Wir kommen gerne wieder.

We had been on swiss tour for a week and visited several towns and restaurants. But By all means TAMARIND HILL food was the finest . Presentation, ambience ,service was all full marks . We had alu tikki and pakoras for starters and vegetarian thali. Every curry in thali was tasty and heart warming . Special appreciations to Mr akshay who made our day complete and it was my wife birthday and she was highly impressed as they were kind enough to absorb drinks on house when they knew it was her birthday . Where can we expect such good gestures in europe . Kudos to tamarind team and owners . Keep the good work going .

I went their with my family after reading the awesome reviews on trip advisor and i think they deserve thatAmazing ambience , proffesional and friendly service, and mouth watering foodLoved the tandoori pineapple in the dessertKeep up the good work guys.... will be back soon :-)
Finally an Indian restaurant in Zurich which is not only fun but tasty and carefully cooked and delicious! I didnt expect this to be possible but it seems it is, thanks!

Was there on a Saturday night and what an amazing experience I was there with my girlfriend and we started with cocktails!!!! Awesome cocktails, amazing food and superb ambience Would definitely be going back with the rest of my gang Talk of the town!!!!

Went to tamarind hill for a late dinner at about 10 pm on a Friday evening. Despite arriving this late, service was great. We shared a starter set and had the most outstanding dal. In particular the dal is highly recommended!

I saw this the other day riding on the tram and, being a lover of Indian food was excited to test out the new spot in my part of town. GREAT! The lunch buffet is all you can eat and very reasonably priced for Zurich. The atmosphere is very nice and can hold many people in and outdoor. Service was great and I plan to return here very often to get my fix! The only bummer about good Indian food...you eat too much!!! I can barely walk away after...I can't stop eating...... :)

Very happy to have a great Indian Restaurant in our neighbourhood! We went there spontaneously and were very pleasantly surprised: it will be our new favourite Indian in Zurich. The food is superb, all spices/curries are home made and a real treat. The service was great and very attentive, the atmosphere relaxed and friendly. We will be back¨!

This restaurant is amazing! The food is very tasty and the service is extraordinary. The owners name is akshay and he the sweetest. They feed you with love in the recipe. The place can get a bit busy in the winter and on the weekends!

A friend and I recently tried out the new Tamarind Hill restaurant and were absolutely delighted. We shared a salad and the veg Thali - a delectable platter of tasty delicacies. The quality of the food was equaled by the presentation and the service. 5 stars!
The best indian Restuarent in Zurich, the hospitality was too good and very pleasing . Had a chance to have dinner and a lunch. The ambience also is commendable . Keep up the good work
My wife and I was eating there, and drinking some white wine. Everything was perfect and in a good taste. The restaurant owner was very nice and the service was very very good. Very recommended!

Went for Sunday dinner and arrived just after 18.00. Luckily we got there early has by time we left it was full.The staff member who served us was very friendly and spoke excellent english.We had a number of starters as we were a party of 6. Veggies and no veggies.All the starters were very tasty and we were all impressed.The mains were equally has tasty. I had rogan josh which was lovely and the nan bread was superb.I think this is now my favourite Indian restaurant in Zurich and can't wait to go back

I was recommended this place by my friend and after being there, I don't see why anyone wouldn't recommend it. The staff are very friendly and the service was excellent. The interiors are clean and there is a section to sit cross-legged and eat the food !!!I complained that the beer was not cold enough after having a sip. They immediately apologised and gave me a fresh cold beer.The food was very yummy and the portions are decent.On the down side, I felt the main dishes are little over-priced....
Was a very nice experience and food was just amazing. Having Thali in Zurich was a treat ;) Kudos to the team !!!

It's an awesome restaurant the restaurant was packed it was a good evening the staff is very friendly and the food was too good and the restaurant was beautiful and thank you tamarind hill for a good evening

Tamarind Hill is an amazing Indian restaurant located in Oerlikon. You can park right in front of the door and there is also a tram station 5m away from the restaurant. My girlfriend and I where welcomed and seated in a very friendly matter. The first thing i noticed was the incredibly friendly staff and the very comfortable chairs. We ordered our food and in the mean while they served us some home cooked chips which was a very nice touch. When the starters came my girlfriend and I where amazed by flavours and aromas of this dish. The highlight of it being the chicken tikka tikka which was The Best we ever had. The main courses (Butter Chicken & Lamb Chettinad) where also of the same great quality as the startes. Well rounded flavours a nice spicy touch. Again we loved it. I highly recommend this place to anyone who is up for amazing Indian food and being spoiled by your host. They take great care of you and they give it a personal touch. In my situation being congratulated for my anniversary. I would sincerely like to thank the hosts and the cook for this amazing experience. Thank you and I will be back.

This restaurant had the wow effect on me and I'm not a easy person to be impressedWe walked in without a reservation and the restaurant was packed . The host greeted us and told us that there would a waiting of 45 minutes , but when he saw me with my kids , he offered me drinks while I was waiting and got some chips and poppadums while we were waiting.We didn't mind as the food was worth waitingThe next we visit Zurich I hope to be back again .
Great Location with Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff which is unusually for Zürich. Amazing Curry Dishes and Great Taste!!! Parking just in Front!!!

The best place to have Indian food It's yummy All those craving for Indian flavour come here Staff is very polite Veg food tastes like heaven here We had daal makhani and paneer butter masala and butter naan

We chose to head here based on its proximity to our hotel, and the likelihood of there being decent veggie options for the vegetarian in our group. Which there were! Lots of options for carnivores and vegetarians alike. The staff were friendly & attentive & the atmosphere was relaxed, we sat outside as it was a warm evening. The place has good style. Most of us chose to eat a thali (for the uninitiated, that's a platter of 4 small curries with rice, naan, raita, pickles etc): one of the meat eaters called it "the best curry he'd ever had". I'm super fussy (veggie but not keen on cheese) and they managed to make me up a thali not containing any paneer, despite a lot of the veggie dishes on the a la carte menu being paneer based. Nothing seemed like too much trouble. We were impressed when we discovered that they'd only been open for a month, and not surprised that they already have another restaurant in Dublin. These guys mean business and we all hope they succeed as they deserve to! Delicious!

6 of us walked in without a reservation and it was packed , so the host offered us the vip section , it was a traditional sit on the ground set up but very tastefully decorated, the food was awesome and the service was great specially the young waiter who dealt with a drunk bunch of usWould be back soon

We went there for dinner. The service was very prompt and welcoming and the ambience very pleasant. The food tasted very authentic Indian. The price is on the higher side though (which is expected in Zurich). Overall, would recommend this restaurant to all wishing for good Indian food.

We have visited today early in the evening for the first time. First of all, we would love to express to the owner our compliments for the interior: beautiful decoration, comfortable furniture, nice ambience scents, lovely background music - everything was creating inviting and authentic atmosphere. Secondly, we felt welcome from the minute we stepped into the restaurant - the staff was very friendly and professional throughout the whole dinner. And the main point: the food!!! My husband is British, and he taught me into loving Indian cuisine the level of which one alas could not have found in Zürich before.. not till today)) Everything was delicious, from mango lassi and starters (I had onion and potato fritters, my husband took lamb kebab, both of delicious taste and beautiful presentation) to main course (we took tandoori butter chicken and lamb korma to share) and naans (omg these naans, we loved them! we tried onion and peshawari naan) Ginger ice tea afterwards refreshed the mouth palette and mango kulfi dessert rounded up the meal. We could hardly move afterwards, but it was all worth it))To sum up our emotions: we highly recommend Tamarind Hill and will come back here again and again!!!

It has yummy Indian food. Its is hard to find authentic Indian taste at restaurants in Europe and often you don't feel it to be worth the money spend. Tamarind on the other hand differs. Along with a fine dining experience, you get food which is worth any penny spent for the dinner.

I think it was the best roganjosh I have tasted so far The restaurant is so beautifully decorated and the host was so nice to us We even got a complimentary shot at the end Would definitely recommend this fine Indian restaurant
Awesome food , beautiful ambience , and very polite service We ordered the thalis and they were beautifully presented and tasted awesome Look forward to go there again

It is a new restaurant well decorated and smart. The staff are very professional and well dressed also. Our normal favorite was closed on the Monday we visited , so we changed to the Tamarind, WOW fab environment and GREAT food the menu has all the usuall favorites plus some stunning alternatives the Fish Tandoori starter was sublime as was the Deep fried Lamb. we all tried everything from each others plates and every thing was wonderfulWe have altered our Itinerary to allow us to return before we leave europe
Excellent food,great place!!authentic Indian cuisine.feel of india sitting in switzerland.Good efforts akshay!!

I generally avoid asian restaurants for my business meetings but when i was crossing this restaurant i was impressed by the exterior The buffet was awesome and the service proffesional , fresh and crisp ambience Would be my regular now Highly recommendable
I can only recommend. Definitely best indian restaurant in Zurich! Service is great, food is excellent, atmosphere is typical. We had a great dinner... Call in advance to book... Today was sold out!
We had a nice experience and can recommend this restaurant with friendly stuff and tasty food! We enjoyed everything we had for dinner.

Food was rightful flavoured for the taste buds. We were in a group of 12 adults and 3 kids. Mostl of them ordered Thali. I had some fish thali which was very good.Dal was very homely and tasty, Other topics like quality, quantity and ambience was also good. A place for special occasions

We have been living in Zürich for many years and visited almost all Indian restaurants here.We went Tamarind hill for a dinner last week and felt to share our experience.At first visit itself Tamarind Hill looked different than the others. We first tested with a take away, liked the food quality and then decided to visit for dinner with family.It was a wonderful dining experience.Pleasant ambiance and friendly service.Impressed that they prepare all spices inhouse and found no artificial colours added in the dishes.Best part was they customized the dishes as per our request with right spice levels.Probably the best Indian restaurant in Zürich.

Wir haben gestern Abend den Geburtstag eines Freundes im Tamarind Hill gefeiert. Wir waren ca 35 Personen. Der ganze Abend war ausgezeichnet. Wir wurden exzellent verköstigt. Alles stimmte und der Abend war einmalig. Auch dank dem Tamarind Hill. Das Essen war exquisit und der Gastgeber weiss noch, was es heisst Gäste zu bewirtschaften. Danke Tamarind Hill. Bis sehr bald wieder...

When on overseas vacation, we generally prefer local dishes and rarely look out for Indian meals. However, during our stay of 5 days at Zurich, we came to know about this newly opened restaurant Tamarind Hill and couple of good reviews on TA and we decided to take a chance of dining at Tamarind Hill Indian Restaurant. The choice turned out to be well worth the money spent. The restaurant is really excellent in terms of ambience, service, hygiene, and above all, the taste of the dishes. We tried a Vegetarian Thali (cost 34.50 CHF) and shared between the two of us. Each and every item of the thali was superb in terms of taste, balanced spices and oil content and the freshness of the dishes. The thali contained one very big piece of nan, 3 vegetable dishes, one dal makhani, curd raita, papad, mint chutney, pickle and rice. The quantity was sufficient for both of us as we don't eat much. Amit was too good in service and suggesting us about the various options for vegetarians like us. The icing on the cake was the complimentary Mango Lassi served by the owner Akshay. We really enjoyed the meals and we would surely recommend others to visit Tamarind Hill Indian Restaurant at Zurich.

The service was very good and immediately created a feel-good atmosphere with their friendly and kind manners. The food (mixed starter platter and chocolate fondue dessert, no main dish) was delicious. We were sitting outside but at first glance the interior seemed very inviting and comfortable. Our overall impression was very positive and we will definitely come again to try the main dishes and more. We would fully recommend Tamarind Hill to anybody.

What a delectable experience and the affable host makes the entire experience even more memorable- carefully chosen silver and tableware, warm yet classy decor and to top it all delicious culinary delights! Loved every bit of it!! Worth coming back!
Best Indian Food I ever ate in Zurich! Even the water smells like syrup ;) Staff is very very friendly! Overall excellent. Worth a visit!
Tolles Ambiente, gutes Essen und sehr freundliche und aufmerksame Bedienung. Komme gerne wieder ins TH!
One of the very few places in Zurich where you get good food and excellent service..!! The restaurant is quite and the staff is very friendly... definitely a visit recommended.

Das neue Restaurant ist wunderschön eingerichtet und sorgt für gemütliche Atmosphäre. Die Bedienung war stets aufmerksam und freundlich. Das Essen (Fisch-Thali) war wunderbar und ich plane schon den nächsten Besuch im Tamarind Hill.

Das Lokal ist sehr schon und stilvoll eingerichtet und verbreitet eine indische Atmosphäre.Das Essen ist perfekt zubereitet und sehr schön angerichtet. Empfehlen kann ich das butter tandoori chicken. Die Teller sind reichhaltig. Zusätzlich wird Chapatibrot gereicht.Das Servicepersonal ist sehr freundlich und aufmerksam. Zudem geben sie Empfehlungen und Tipps und kennen sich bezüglich Zutaten und Zubereitung der Gerichte aus.Preis/Leistung stimmt absolut. Ich kann das Lokal zu 100% empfehlen.PS. Das Tamarind Hill lieg keine zehn Gehminuten vom Hallenstadion entfernt. Man kann sich also sehr gut vor einem Konzert oder Hockeymatch verpflegen.
I had gone to this restaurant with my friends and it was an unexpected experience Beautiful ambience, excellent service and very nice food Will be back soon

Ieri sera abbiamo cenato in questo nuovo ristorante indiano e ne siamo rimasti piacevolmente sorpresi.Ottima accoglienza da parte del proprietario e servizio eccellente da parte del cameriere.Abbiamo scelto l'entrata della casa per 2 persone e in seguito tandoori butter chicken e lamb roganjosh (questo piatto è abbastanza piccante ma molto buono). Come dessert ananas e gelato. Il tutto buonissimo e a prezzi veramente onesti.Ci sono stati anche gentilmente offerti un bicchiere di rosé e una bibita al mango.Torneremo di sicuro!!
Visited this evening for dinner. Excellent food, ambience and excellent service. Friendly staff. Overall very good experience. Highly recommended.
i was there with family, food quality is amazing. service is excellent. he knows how to treat guests.

We're so happy to have this lovely new Indian restaurant open around the corner. So far we've only been for the lunch buffet (3 times in the 2 weeks they've been open...!) - they have a great selection of starters, meat dishes, vegetarian dishes and sides. I'm hoping at some point to be able to get there for dinner as the a la carte menu looks amazing. The drinks also deserve a mention as there is clearly a lot of thought put into their creations (hot orange and mint tea - yummy!). The staff are friendly and welcoming - highly recommended :)

After reading all the amazing reviews and recommendations from my friends I reallly wanted to try the restaurant Beautiful ambience and top notch service Im from delhi but I think the best butter chicken I had so far was in tamarind

I happened to land into Tamarind Hill because a friend wanted to try it out. I was skeptical about yet another new Indian restaurant in Zurich. But this was a pleasant surprise.We tried two starters which were pretty good. For main course we had malai kofta, aloo jeera and bhindi with garlic naan. Every dish was delicious. Jimmy took care of the fact that the kid with us got what she wanted in her kiddo menu. The cocktail was top notch too.I cannot wait to try out their other dishes. Tamarind Hill is definitely a couple of notches above the other mediocre Indian restaurants in Zurich, especially when it comes to taste and service. The deco and theme is also good.
sehr gutes Essen und sehr freundliche Bedienung! Ist sehr zum empfehlen. War definitiv nicht mein letzer Besuch im Tamarind Hill.
Sehr nette Bedienung, entspannte Atmosphäre und sehr schön und stimmungsvoll eingerichtet. Die hausgemachten Eistees sind sehr zu empfehlen!

amazing food , very beautiful restaurant and good service .they also had the halal option which was great in the end we had the tandoori pineapple as a dessert , never tried that before ,it was amazing
Lovely restaurant , amazing food , very friendly service, attention to detail . One of the best indian restaurant I have ever been to. Fresh flavours . Absolutely fab .

I was with my family there to celebrate Mother's Day and it was a very good experienceI was surprised to see such a professional and kids friendly restaurant . They even had a kids menu . My kids were delighted and the host was very friendlyWould definitely recommendFive stars !!!!

I was not feeling the best and was craving for a nice hot indian curry when i saw excellect reviews for this restaurant on trip advisorWhen i entered it was simply a wow factor to it .... The starters were amazing specially the tawa machi .... Then i had the lamb roganjosh which was the best i had so far in zurichOverall the ambience , the food , the service ... Could not fault anything .... At last we have a proper indian restaurantNot to forget ...do try there fresh orange and mint tea ... It just did the magic for me

An amazing dinner with friends. The food was exquisite, presentation immaculate. Jimmy the restaurant owner, went over and beyond to add his touch of personal expertise to the evening. His personality compliments the atmosphere. Will definitely be going back :)

Stopped over in Zurich for just one night on my way to Australia so I really wanted to make the perfect choice for dinner. Went their on a friend's recommendation and it proved to be worth every penny. The service, food and ambience everything is top notch. The staff pays attention to the smallest of detail and the food is just lip smacking. A must visit for me next time i'm here.
Awesome restaurant!! Great food, beautiful interior and very friendly staff! We will be back soon!!!
We went out for dinner with friends and spent an amazing evening in this restaurant. Excellent authentic Indian cuisine, very friendly multilingual crew.

Exceptional experience started with a mixed plater : samosa, prawns, lamb and little vegetarian options followed by chicken chettinad for spice lovers and creamy and mild paneer butter masala together with coconut-and-dry fruit bread and finished with awesome panacota and tendoori pineapple and chocolate fondant. AMAZING service !!! Very friendly atmosphere. The owner is very caring and attentive. A must see in Zurich !

Nice presented drinks accompagnied with crispy fingerfood and delicious chutneys. The maincourses looked all so good. Difficult to choose 1 but we all were more then happy with what we ordered. The service was very good. Very and helpfull waiters.
Was going out with friends last night when we accidently came across tamarind hill I think it was the best indian we have had so far in zurich

We were impressed by the high quality of food and service at this new location. The recommendations of the owner after short enquiries to our preferences were spot on. Each plate of food was freshly prepared to our taste. Nice ambience and friendly staff, made an enjoyable evening out. To experience how good and individual the Indian cuisine is, this is the place to go to.

I was on my way from the airport to zurich city centre when I noticed the restaurant Tamarind hill. This wasnt the first Indian cuisine restaurant i noticed on the way. But the design and decor of Tamarind hill attracted me towards it.I checked the menu and was happy and confused at the same time. It was filled with the titles of all the delicious dishes which is rare in Europe actually.The food was perfect and worth the money. The service was excellent. The restaurant had the perfect atmosphere to chill out after a tough day.I would recommend everybody to go to this place and check the food out.
way to go tamrind hill ! very warm hospitality ! great food ! nice to have a place like ths in zurich
